text: Figo has been easy to understand, easy to get signed up, easy to use.   This is our first time with pet insurance so I was a little worried how it would all go down. We had a claim during our pup's first year and I have to say, Figo made the process very easy. I was missing something they needed and they contacted our vet themselves and got what they needed, and they included me in the email loop. We just finished year one and will continue on with Figo.

text: We got a puppy March 2023. I enrolled him in FIGO insurance right away for illness/accident coverage. In June he suffered a severe break to his hind leg. At the emergency vets we were given an estimate of $7,000 to $8,000 to repair. Never expected this expense but thank goodness we had insurance. I had no idea how much would be covered but of course we said to proceed with the surgery. I was very impressed with how easy and quickly I could submit a claim and receive reimbursement for covered expenses. Customer service was excellent when I had questions. I was always kept informed of the status of the claim which made it a seamless process. So thankful our only worry was getting Louie healed and not the cost. He fully recovered! Thanks to all at FIGO.
title: Be ready for anything with a puppy

text:
I have purchased an insurance policy for my cat since 2019.  In 2020, my cat was not feeling well.  I brought him in to our local vet for a check up.  Check ups were not covered in my policy at that time. The doctor noted that my cat was constipated, and recommended a science diet recipe.  

Two weeks ago I had to take my cat to  emergency care because he had not eaten, urinated or had a bowel movement in 24 hours.  I did not treat my cat at emergency care, he was given subcutaneous fluids; and since he was not in crisis, he was released without a diagnosis or prescription.

The next morning I took my cat to our current vet.  He was diagnosed with a urinary tract infection for which he was given antibiotics.

…. BUT because my previous vet in 2019 gave my cat a laxative, my claims were denied.  The constipation was one of the symptoms for his most recent treatment NOT the condition, but even so my claims were denied.

I have filed two claims (most recent emergency care and follow up)  in the last five years, only to be denied because my cat had been constipated five years ago.

This is an egregious breech of contract.  The pact is that I  pay my insurance premium every month, so should my cat become ill, I can provide my four-legged family member the medical care he requires, even if it’s thousands of dollars.

Denying the claim is a poor showing of the good faith between client and insurer.  I whole heartedly do NOT recommend FIGO; and once my appeal is closed, I will no longer hold a policy with them.
title: Do not insure with FIGO - Bad show of good faith.

text: Pretty quick to cancel your policy if you miss a payment. Had the wrong card in after closing it. No phone call, just a statement in the mail. Then they charge a reactivation fee. They need to do better on reaching out to their customers.
title: Pretty quick to cancel your policy if…

text:
Figo, the king of insurance Gaslighting. 

They first tire you out by making you jump through hoops, then make you happy, then not pay, then ghost you, then more hoops, then deny your claim on any technicality they can find. Then deny your appeal because you had a legitimate claim. Because they know that you won’t sue them. Psychopaths.

 Despite my initial enthusiasm and hope, they have proven to be unreliable and untrustworthy as an insurance provider. Here’s a rundown of the issues I’ve encountered:

	1.	After filing a claim, it was closed without explanation, leaving me waiting for payment for 14 days.
	2.	Upon contacting them, I was kept on hold for 27 minutes only to be told they needed more information, which they allegedly already communicated to my vet. However, my vet confirmed they received no such notification.
	3.	When I followed up with Figo, I was informed their app was down and that they would now process the claim.
	4.	Despite their assurances, I was then bombarded with paperwork and additional tasks for my vet.
	5.	After more back-and-forth, I received a claim closed email with a broken link and no information in the Figo app.
	6.	Upon calling again, I was told my plan didn’t cover the incident because it fell outside a 14-day grace period for illnesses, being day 13, and that the day I signed up was not the day they started my plan. Even though it was an injury, not an illness. They then cited a bizarre 6-month grace period for skeletal injuries, leaving me baffled and frustrated.

I had signed up for their highest-tiered plan at $57 a month for my recently rescued Chihuahua, only to be met with disappointment and a sense of being scammed. This experience has left me questioning the legitimacy of their services and I am requesting, at the very least, a refund of my initial premium payment.
title: Figo

text: Never was reimbursed. I took Goddie to the vet, not for yearly check up but because he wasn’t feeling good. He had an ear infection and had picked an eye with a rose bush. I spend over $200 and NEVER got reimbursed.  I did not renew insurance this year.

text:
Settling claims with Figo feels like leaving things to chance. While their marketing and support teams shine with a solid 5-star rating, the experience with the claim department tells a different tale. In an unregulated realm of insurance, Figo seems to exploit the lack of oversight by crafting policies with vague language. The claim department operates on a subjective basis, free to approve or deny based on unclear criteria.
For instance, the policy vaguely excludes "pre-existing conditions" without offering a proper definition. Most would assume "pre-existing" refers to ongoing issues or those present at policy inception, not something your pet was cured of in the past. Figo's agents appear more focused on delving into your pet's medical history, searching for any past ailment that could be loosely connected to the current issue, even if they're unrelated.
Unless you enjoy simply paying premiums, exploring alternatives might be a wise move.
title: Claims settled by a roll of the dice

text:
Original policy was issued 12/20/2022 and automatically renewed on 12/20/2023.

My dog had tooth extraction on 12/20/2023.  Claim denied on 1/9/2024 based on tooth extraction was within waiting period.

However, waiting period only applies to original policy not renewal policies,  Policy definitions #43 and Benefits section #5.

Appeal promptly on 1/10/2024.  Received only computer generated receipt stating I would be contacted.  As of 1/18/2024, no response and no status indication in Pet Cloud.

Called customer number simply to make sure the Appeal had been received.  Customer support wanted all my credit card info including 16 digit number and date of expiration - THIS WAS NOT A BILLING ISSUE AND THIS WAS NOT THE ACCOUNTS DEPARTMENT.  FIGO automatically bills my credit card every month with no issues.

I declined giving such personal credit card identification to some customer support person who had absolutely no need for it simply to find out if my Appeal had been docketed.

text:
I have been incredibly disappointed in Figo. The company goes out of its way to obstruct the claims process, via prematurely closing claims within 24 hours of requesting documentation, requesting documentation from veterinarians unrelated to the  claim (even a veterinary office that had never seen my pet before), and using middle men in customer service to prevent direct communication with claims adjusters, and claiming pre-existing conditions if nothing else works. I feel that Figo does not care about the satisfaction of its customers or the health of their pets. I have cancelled auto-renewal of my policy, and have told other people to stay away from Figo.


PS - In response to the reply from Figo, I have already called the claims department 4 times regarding these issues with no resolution
title: Figo closes claims within 24 hours to avoid payouts.

I had a problem submitting a claim, and it told me to call. I called and they said to leave a message and they would get back to me. They did not.   And it’s not the first time where they’ve asked you to leave a message and they don’t call you back.  Submitting claims is confusing and it doesn’t give you full information.


I received a reply on this site about calling them.  I called. I got put on hold for at least 10 minutes so I hung up.  I called back. I got an explanation on my benefits however, I did not get an explanation as to why no one ever calls back.  The excuse was there was a holiday.  That was only one of the four days.  I have another call into them right now to speak to a supervisor. They need to make changes to their customer service.

text:
This was the best decision I made when caring for my pets. The claims process is super easy and reimbursement lightening fast. 100% worth the peace of mind. I learned the hard way with former pets so made the decision to carry pet insurance right out of the gate this time. 

I rescued two cats recently - one a kitten and one an adult cat. Surprisingly the kitten is the one with the constant issues and recently diagnosed with IBD. We had to run her through a battery of tests. This would have cost me thousands out of pocket which I would have done because I love these freakin’ cats. A claim has never been denied, I am able to care for my babies without catastrophic financial concerns - I couldn’t be happier!
title: Best.Decison.Ever.

The kittens we adopted had recurrent respiratory infections and though they are now under control, I would say the insurance paid for itself! Being able to text a vet with additional questions or to get advice is a WONDERFUL feature, and the piece of mind that comes with knowing that I will actually be able to afford what they need to stay healthy is unequivocally the BEST part of having insurance. It has eliminated the most stressful aspect of owning a pet. Thanks a million!

She was seen by multiple rehab vets who also back up that my dog has no injury or any signs of pain yet figo refuses to listen to any of them over one vet noting “PERCEIVED owner discomfort after extreme exertion” vet notes no signs of pain or injury. I never knew a very tired dog was considered pre existing to figo when a vet noted multiple times there’s nothing wrong with the dog

text:
annual premium increased 38% ($135) after one year with zero claims for three year old healthy pet.  no explanation provided.  when i called to review the increase with agent, she could not provide anything specific, just pointed to the fact that "CA rates may be higher than other states...."

agents are extremely nice and polite, but have had to call/email/follow-up somewhere between 5-10 times for the same question regarding why my declining deductible benefit was never reduced by $50 after the first year without any paid claims...still fighting to get this benefit...

the final reveal that I have been scammed is that they declined over $1k in dental surgery costs my pet required for tooth extractions by referencing their policy that any sort of prior dental issue makes them not liable to pay for dental issues.  Even if the event needing coverage is unrelated to the condition that was present during the waiting period. Meaning, because my pet had evidence of the grade 1 tarter (the lowest besides 0) during the waiting period they denied payment for her tooth extractions caused by periodontal disease.  The vet even wrote a letter stating this disease was not present prior to her needing the extractions. My pet had regular and repeated exams that never revealed any issues or treatment plans for her teeth.  Their fine print allows them to deny coverage because she had this minor issue and unrelated issue.  What's the point of having insurance when you can find a way to weasel out of paying every claim?  Will be changing to more reputable company.
title: 33% premium increase and denial of coverage.  Waste of time and money.

text: Okay, I don't write many letters to hardly anyone. This anomaly follows your out-of-this-world claims processing.  I have worked in the allied medical field for three decades. This produced an abhorrence for the insurance companies involved. They are in the business not to pay. I'll stop there.  Today my lovely-lady had her distemper shot (no cheap comments) and doing fine. I sent the claim in at  3:53 PM EDT (ON A FRIDAY).  The claim was closed at 4:33 PM, FOURTY minutes later and payment made to my lovely-lady's checking account.   I want to shout it from above, insurance companies CAN do things right.  I'm beyond amazed.  I'll be telling this story for a long time, it's too good to be true!
title: Not Like Any Insurance Company

text:
Luna was diagnosed with a yeast infection in her ear.
7 months or so later, she developed a rash on her head, neck, and unluckily for us, near her ear.  The claim was rejected as it was a "similar" dermatological condition within the same rolling 12 months."  

Even her Dr. wrote that the issues were completely unrelated and not even the same condition.  But that didn't matter.  Maybe if the rash had been on her belly far away from her ear, we would have had some financial relief.

It's sad to post this, I've had Figo with two other pets and they used to be wonderful.
title: Dermatological issue loophole

text:
I absolutely hate Figo. They are great with routine care, but they will find any and all ways to get out paying out claims for more serious claims. They claim my dog had an pre-existing condition or accident before waiting period - I saw a neurosurgon that confirmed he did not agree with Figo's assessment. I appealed the decision twice with documentation from the neurosurgeon. Yet, Figo still refused to pay. I wish I could switch to another insurance provider, but other plans will now also consider the condition pre-existing. So I am stuck with horrible pet insurance.

If you have a young dog with no documented health problems before your policy starts with Figo, then they might be good for you. But otherwise, stay far away.
title: I absolutely hate Figo

text:
Seems like these guys have purchased a bunch of fake reviews. I am also in the process of discussing these scamsters with Costco (as costco vouched for their services).

A basic illness claim for diarrhea which has an office vet visit (I have purchased the office visit addon), some prescription medication, and a fecal test was denied. And as per the EOB the reason claimed was code 16 - the policy does not provide coverage for future services… like seriously, what future service are we talking about????

My dog had diarrhea, I took him to the vet, the vet gave medication and did some tests, I submitted an illness claim with the payment receipt and the claim was denied with this vague explanation on future services.. How can a vet exam, medication administered, and a diagnostic test be a future service..

Either they do not have qualified adjusters who understand plain and simple english or they are total scamsters who are reaping the benefits of an unregulated industry and are giving random reasons not to pay.

This was my first claim and this experience with the first claim has set me back.. I would suggest stay away from these people..
title: FIGO is a total Scam - Stay Away

text:
Figo has been amazing. It gives me so much peace knowing that I can pay my dogs vet bill with my credit card (if I don’t have enough cash) and get refunded a significant portion of the bill in just the matter of a couple days, literally. I don’t make a lot of money so it’s unrealistic for me to be able to pay a $600 vet bill out of pocket but with Figo, I use my credit card at the vet and Figo refunds me 90% of the bill back on my credit card so I really only spent $60 out of the $600 that was paid to the vet. The monthly payment for Figo is also not expensive and the benefits are great! I recommend Figo to literally everybody I know that has animals. It’s been lifesaving especially with inflation going up like crazy for food, rent, gas, etc. I can promise you I’m 110% a real person, I also read reviews and question whether the person is actually real or not.

UPDATE: Yes Figo

text:
This company basically uses any reason to deny a claim. Every time we make an illness related claim, they will say it was due to something preventable by vaccine so they are not liable to pay. 

We took our aussie puppy to the vet because she seemed to have a slight cough and throat irritation. The vet said she likely has allergies and asked us to use benadryl to alleviate the symptoms. He also prescribed an anti-biotic because she is a puppy, and out of an abundance of caution, in case there was an upper respiratory infection. No where in the medical record did he mention it was kennel cough. But Figo denied the claim. They made their own diagnosis, ignoring the vet, and said it is kennel cough. They won't pay for Kennel cough because it is preventable by a vaccine. Out vet did not recommend the vaccine at our puppy's age just yet (since she is going through the course of parvo vaccines). Figo claims that we rejected giving her the vaccine which is false.

Don't get this insurance, and definitely don't get their wellness package. It pretends to be cheaper than the others but they don't pay for any claim. What a total scam!
title: Don't get Figo. They will deny all claims and give you random reasons.

text:
I highly recommend Figo pet insurance.

Our black lab unfortunately tore both ACL's in her back legs.

We filed a claim shortly after her surgery, and at first the claim was denied due to inaccurate information provided by the veterinarian office who diagnosed her and performed the procedure . 

After a follow-up discussion with the veterinarian, an appeal of the original claim denial was filed, and Figo approved the claim and honored the policy. 

While the claim process was a bit lengthy, and at times challenging, in the end Figo did the right thing and approved our claim.

text:
I experienced the same frustrations and failures of service that many, many, many other customers have experienced with Figo Pet Insurance. It is amazing to me that, having had so many complaints about the same issues, over and over again, Figo continues to act in a purposefully misleading manner and continues to fail in providing customer service.

First, “pre-existing condition” seems to mean “your pet was alive when you got this insurance” and they simply flat out refuse to cover any medical issues at all. I have attempted to make 3 completely justified claims, all clearly allowed by my policy, and Figo has given the same reason for denying my claim all three times: not allowed due to a “pre-existing condition.”

The key example is that my dog had to have two teeth removed, $1,300 for each tooth, for a total of $2,600 in fees. My insurance has a $1,000 deductible, so I was assuming I would get $1,600 back. I submitted my claim and, within a few hours, received my rejection due to “pre-existing condition.” 

Figo indicated that a vet examination (WHILE my dog was covered by insurance) identified a fracture on ONE of the teeth, but not the other. IF I am willing to accept that this one tooth wasn’t covered (due to the vet identifying a “likely carnassial fracture,” even though my dog was still covered by insurance), then the other cracked tooth SHOULD be covered since it was NOT identified by the vet during the previous exam. 


Yep, you guessed it, Figo rejected my claim for BOTH teeth, citing the vet report. Basically, my dog was not covered for ANY dental emergency of any kind because he had ONE problem with ONE tooth previously. An absolute joke, and a clear case of fraud. 

After multiple attempts at communication with Figo customer service, they essentially just copied and pasted the same response back to me…ie… “pre-existing condition, pre-existing condition.” 

FIGO insurance will make every attempt to refuse a payout if they can and will use “pre-existing condition” as the excuse. 

This insurance is a complete waste of money; not only am I out the money for my pet’s treatment, I am also out the premiums for this 100% useless pet insurance. 

Read the reviews online carefully and you will see the complaint over and over again. FIGO pet insurance does NOT payout, they look for any reason to claim “pre-existing condition” and then reject your claim.
title: Worst Pet Insurance ever - total scam

text: Overall, FIGO seems like a great deal for decent pet insurance.  Blows the competition out of the water.  In reality, it's extremely difficult to get anything to apply to your coverage.  I am a benefits specialist, and very familiar with reading benefit plan documents and interpreting coverage.  There has been many instances where my pet's condition/injury/illness may have been covered but were denied.  After going through the claims dispute process, I still wasn't satisfied with FIGO's rejection.  I renewed coverage for a second year out of convenience.  I will continue to consider other pet insurance options in the future.  That said, I hope FIGO still proves to be of some value.
title: Is anything covered?

text: Complete bait and switch company. My pup injured her eye playing for the 1st time. It was not a genetic condition whatsoever. Figo denied the claim even though I had an eye surgeon confirm it was due to an injury in WRITING! Claim was denied even when contested they paid ZERO dollars. Cost me over $8k out of pocket not including after care. I was so distraught I didn’t cancel. Later my dog hurt her leg as she was getting up in the years at 13. It wasn’t a huge bill but around $1000 in care and meds. Claim denied! Why do I have insurance?!  I had top tier insurance I was paying for all 3 of my dogs. I was spending nearly $400 a month for several years. I would’ve been better off depositing that money in a high yield savings account! I just now got around to writing a review. Wish I had made time sooner to hopefully save you so you don’t make the same mistake I did and lose thousands of dollars!
title: Complete bait and switch company

text:
My dog had an intestinal obstruction just after Christmas 2022. (He is an 9lb Yorkie who ate a 4oz package of chocolate covered hazelnuts! One hazelnut didn’t come back up and stayed in his intestines for 4 days, causing a laundry list of ailments/problems) 

This incident required X-rays, an ultrasound, medications, observation, IV fluids, multiple vet visits, and ultimately- emergency surgery plus two nights in an emergency vet post surgery. This was a very stressful, emotional experience- I was really worried and upset. 

Once I called in to FIGO and a representative explained what would be covered, I was so relieved!! I felt so much less stress that I wasn’t going to be responsible for a total of  $5,800 in vet bills, and I could focus my energy on getting him home and caring for him post surgery.

At times (prior to this emergency situation) there had been small things FIGO didn’t cover (which is how insurance works) and several things they did…. But when I needed them the most, they were there. I am a very happy, grateful customer!
title: Emergency surgery, on a holiday!

text:
This reimbursement plan has been absolutley stellar the first year of coverage. It's a necessity these days as veterinary services have increased 3fold the last few years. If you're uninsured and complaining about vet bills, you're doing it wrong.

I see most of the negative reviews are mostly lack of knowledge of how the plan works. First off, it's a "reimbursement plan" meaning; you pay for services and upload receipts, if they meet the plans criteria, a percentage is reimbursed. You also don't need to stay "in network" but you also have to meet your deductible before the reimbursement payments start. You also have to READ your policy before signing off, because that's half the battle. I inadvertently didn't include wellness my first years policy, and questioned why a certain bill was denied and they just explained wellness wasn't selected and to make sure to select when renewing. Calling/texting them directly is the best way to communicate and they strive for doing just that, clear explanations.

If it's seen as "pre-existing", no, they won't cover so it's usually the veterinarian that determined that to be the case, as they will sometimes contact the vet directly when there are questions or treatment notes are needed. It's the best we've had, and they continue to be now for over a year. READ the plans people, before purchasing. The uploads can be filed within the Pet Cloud app VERY easily, and I just snap a pic/scan on phone, open app, and submit. There is nothing easier. If you don't use smart phone, you'll need to scan and upload the bills via computer.

Make sure you know what your deductible is as well. You have so many plans to choose from and add-ons to protect your expenses. I'm just scrolling through these negative reviews and most are based on blindly navigating the company, purchasing a policy and have no idea what they bought or are making something so simple---just difficult.
title: This reimbursement plan has been…

FIGO did not reimburse any of the $7000.00 that went into surgery and visits and I sadly do not trust them to provide any if I appealed. I will no longer be supporting this insurance.

title: Figo has denied every single claim

text: We’ve had Figo insurance for almost a year now and so happy we signed up! Both of our dogs ended up having multiple visits to the vet towards the end of last year and it was such a relieve to be able to get them the tests and procedures that they needed without worrying about the money. One dog had a broken tooth (which dentals are EXPENSIVE) and the other had a foxtail removal and digestive issues that had to be addressed. The process to submit claims is super fast and easy on their app or website. The longest we had to wait for a claim to be closed and paid was maybe about 2 weeks at the start because we needed to get them all the vet records from before starting the insurance. Once that was dealt with, all other claims have been closed and paid within a week at the most. We also have the Wellness add-on option and we have been reimbursed for preventative stuff like heart-worm tests and vaccines. Just yesterday, one of our dogs got the test and vaccines and the claim was approved the same day! We are very happy with the insurance so far and definitely plan on renewing!
title: Fast and easy claims!

text:
Purchased pet insurance with Figo on March 8th 2022 after speaking with a representative and was assured ease of use and reimbursement with non pre-existing conditions. Note that we already had pet insurance and never would have switched if we were given grace period policies. Our pet was in excellent health with regular vet visits (all documented). Six months later we took our pet to the vet for an immediate visit due to limping. Surgery was administered shortly after (again all documented). The appt was on Sept 14th, which falls after the grace period (Sept 9th) yet the insurance company is claiming that this is a pre-existing condition, which it is NOT.

I have made two appeals with the insurance company and both were denied. You are not given more than two appeal attempts (how convenient for Figo). The vet also wrote two letters summarizing the events and that it was not a pre-existing condition. I have also submitted a claim & complaint with my state division of insurance.

It seems Figo will do just about anything to deny claims on the basis that they are all pre-existing. Pay the extra $20 for a better insurance company that will actually take care of your pet in need and not leave you out to dry with financial burden.
title: Horrible claims coverage experience…

text: Figo hides all of the tiny printed details in their policy information. Essentially what it says, when I finally found it is that in the first 6 months of coverage,( in my case a 10 week old puppy) everything is an exclusion including anything orthopedic, gastrointestinal and skin related. That is basically EVERYTHING! If you make a single claim in the first 6 months, it is considered a pre-existing condition and therefore will NEVER be covered again in the pups life. This insurance is a SCAM. The policy was $104 and I paid for 9 months before I read the other reviews and realized how useless this insurance is. CANCEL NOW!!

Yet I am paying $198 for a year of the Wellness Plus AND paying more than that out of pocket for completely necessary vaccines and more. text: We will be canceling our insurance very soon. What Figo “covers” is almost a joke. We pay over $100 per month for our two dogs. They covered only $90 of their routine, annual visit (which cost us almost $1000) despite us paying for the advanced wellness plan. Their limits are insanely low - $45 for exams, something similar for teeth cleanings. How does that help at all? Teeth cleanings in our area range from $600-$1500 for a single dog. Oh, and they’re relentless about “pre-existing conditions.” They denied our recent visit to the vet, where we found out our dog has gingivitis, because there were notes in older visits about her having plaque. We’re better off just putting the money we’re throwing away on this insurance into a savings account to pay for these things ourselves.

Since i had said at one vet appointment less than a year previous that he had vomited,it was considered a pre existing condition so it was not covered to the full amount. I used to work as a vet assistant and almost any condition a dog ends up with, the symptoms are vomiting  diarrhea  and not eating. So to say that he had vomited once before that had nothing to do with an allergic reaction and it be considered pre existing was crazy to me. Other than that the insurance for my cat has been great. Also each of the individual coverages are for sure not enough to cover. They're about 50-65% of what stuff actually costs.
title: Not worth it.

text:
1) Your websites says "No Per Incident Caps". 

However, you did not reimburse the full amount charged by the vet.

2) Your website says "Depending on your plan, deductible, and reimbursement options, up to 100% of your dog's vet bills may be reimbursed."

This is incorrect because even if I had a different plan, my expenses would not be covered 100% due to your hidden fine prints.

3) Insurance plan says "Vet Exam Fees for Accident and Illness visits.

This is also incorrect because my claim was for consultation, diagnostics and treatment of my pet, beyond preventive care, and still it was not covered.

--
Since there was no place to reply to Figo's last comment. I am putting it here.

I have forwarded case details to support at figopetinsurance.com and will update here about what they do about this case.

text:
Great marketing gets you in the door.  But dealing with claims people feels like insurance.  

Sample FIGO communication regarding our dog's ortho waiver: "Thank you for providing this information. We have received [your dog's] completed orthopedic waiver form with the exam performed on 08/20/2021. This has been reviewed and applied to his policy. The 6-month waiting period has now been waived for the orthopedic conditions that were assessed during the 08/20/2021 exam and do not show any clinical signs or symptoms. The left front limb is excluded based on the waiver and medical records received from [your dog's] veterinarian. The waiver and medical records show outside palpation and a recommendation for radiographs. Until a further orthopedic exam and diagnostics can be run, these conditions may not be eligible for coverage as they were noted to be abnormal on the waiver and medical records. To clarify, the orthopedic waiver is not a guarantee of coverage."

All that because our vet's exam notes indicated: "Outside palpation - looks OK.  If further test needed recommend x-ray."  The waiver form doesn't require an x-ray.  And the vet's note just indicated the limits of his exam (palpation).  Seems clear to me.  But it wasn't to the FIGO "claims support team."    

So, after incurring the expense of a vet exam to get FIGO's ortho waiver form signed, we decided to just wait out the 6 month ortho exclusion period rather than jump through more hoops (and incur more expense) for the FIGO claims support team.  

We haven't made any claims under our policy (which we have renewed for a second year), and hopefully, we won't need to.  But, based on the ortho waiver experience, I wouldn't be surprised if there are more hoops to jump through.  

Bottom line: Don't be fooled by the touchy feely marketing.  It's insurance.  So, read your policy carefully and expect FIGO claims to assert all available coverage defenses in the event of a claim.
title: Jury's Out

text:
I bought this because my dogs are getting older and I know I don't make enough money to pay for everything if they got really sick. I looked back through my policy, and it should have been covered. So I contacted support asking about it and was given this very curt "screw you" type of message. I tried filing it again in the hopes that it was just a mistake and I got bad customer service, but it was declined again. So I paid over $300 for pet insurance that I couldn't even use when I needed it. Worst waste of money in a long time. Luckily, my vet was willing to work with me and did the surgery at a reasonable price. 
Do not work with this company. They're only here to take your money, and will not help when you need it.

text: After doing a tremendous amount of research regarding pet insurance, I ultimately chose Figo because of the coverage they "purported" to provide, and because they were backed by Costco.  I purchased 3 policies for 3 separate pets, one of which was for a brand new puppy we obtained from a top reputable breeder.  Just prior to that puppies 1 year birthday, he came down with horrible diarrhea, lethargy and wouldn't eat.  I took him to the vet who diagnosed him accordingly (nothing too serious), and provided appropriate prescriptions.  I then submitted the claim to Figo.  To my shock, Figo immediately rejected my claim, on the basis that the diarrhea was a "pre-existing condition."  Huh?? First, how is diarrhea a "pre-existing" condition? Second, even if it was the symptom of some "pre existing" condition, what possible "pre-existing" condition could a full-bred Golden-Retriever puppy have that would cause diarrhea?  I had provided all of our puppies documents, vaccine records, and medical clearances when I submitted the claim.  On top of that, I provided the name and phone number of the breeder in case they had any questions.  Furious with this decision, I appealed the decision.  Figo responded that because I had not provided medical documents with SOAP notes,  any condition my dog had within the first 12 months of the policy was considered "pre existing."  I then resubmitted all of my dog's paperwork.  Suddenly, it was sufficient; they reversed their appeal and applied costs to my deductible. "Ok," you say, "you got what you were entitled to."  Well, the story isn't over.  When I looked at the EOB to review what had been applied, it was pennies on the dollar.  They didn't give me credit for 80-90% of what I paid for my dog's appointment, tests, etc.  One excuse code after another.  What a joke.  I'd stay away.  Do your research and read other reviews on Figo.  I'm not alone.
title: Stay Away!  They Will Do Everything to Deny Your Claim and Not Pay You

text:
Finally cancelled my policy with Figo.  1 star for the sign up process and the gift tag and bowl they send you in the mail.  I had Figo for a total of 7 months.  (Signed up when my puppy was 3 months old) Anyway, they find every reason under the sun to deny your claim.  Most recently, I got a claim denied for an ear infection because he was seen months ago for a SEPARATE dermatological issue.  The first issue was a bump on his neck, and they denied the ear infection with this explanation "If Your Pet showed Clinical Signs of any Dermatological Condition prior to the end of the Waiting Period, Your Pet must be free of any Dermatological Conditions for twelve (12) consecutive monthsbefore any Dermatological Conditions may be covered again"

My fault for not reading the policy in it's entirety.  Learn from my mistake and choose a different provider. I was able to find another pet insurance that wont just lump things into a category.

In the last year I spent 1174.72 at the vet, and Figo paid out 72.90 LOL.  Mind you my deductible was $250 and I paid extra for the wellness ride that covers some vaccinations which is what they paid out.  I paid in total 88 per month for 7 months.  The math says: FIGO IS A WASTE OF MONEY. COMPLETELY USELESS.

text: I have used Figo Pet Insurance for several years now. My previous dog had some serious health issues - and I added insurance too late to cover many of them, but some new ones came up that were covered, no questions asked by Figo. It was super easy to make a claim and get money back on expenses and procedures. When my dog unfortunately passed away, I chatted with an agent a couple of weeks later when I realized I was still paying for insurance and they backdated my account to the date I lost my pup and refunded money to me. They were so compassionate and willing to help. When we adopted our new dog last year, applying for Figo Pet Insurance was the first thing we did. It makes me feel a huge sigh of relief knowing we have it for whatever may come our way!
title: Hands down - BEST pet insurance - compassionate team and easy to submit claims..

text: My 80 lb lab was limping for 3 weeks.  took her to the vet and in the course of positioning her for an x-ray, they broke her femur. Turns out her bone was deteriorated (thus cause for the limping) and bone cancer was suspected.  Immediately took her to a pet emergency room, where they evaluated her and kept her overnight until she could be moved to the orthopedic clinic where surgery was performed the next day to amputate her leg.  Figo was great!  Claims filed online and support docs easily uploaded to their website.  Claims for both the ER stay and the surgery were evaluated and approved in less than 24 hours.  Great job on making a stressful situation a lot less stressful.  Would recommend Figo wholeheartedly.
title: Limping turned into amputation

text:
My experience  with Figo is that they are the insurance company Mr. Incredible (Bob) worked for while he was in hiding.  They are in the  business of NOT paying for anything, in fact you will need a lawyer to  help you navigate their submission/resubmission/denials as they run you around the gauntlet.  If you're looking for peace  of mind,  this  is not your  company.  If  you love conflict, this is your  company.. Heck, they even review each claim and second guess your Vet's prescriptions for  your pet.. you heard that right, they'll  say, "Well, we didn't feel this medicine was necessary for that ailment".. yup, that's right,  your  vet is  not your vet, Figo is the back-seat driving vet...    While Figo was my first pet insurance experience, I'm old enough to have almost 50 years  of other insurances under my belt, including many-many claim situations... Figo?  Bottom of the heap... nice app, bad service.

Oh, I read another  post  and was reminded  that they just magically increase your  premiums,  drastically...    Yes,  they do.  Nice initial  quote,  won't last.

Run, don't walk, away from Figo
title: Run, don't walk away from Figo

text:
I am confident that the people at Figo do not care at all about our pets. In about a year of coverage, they have denied every single claim, stating each occasion for our visit to the vet is due to preexisting conditions (we made a really regrettable choice of switching to Figo from Healthy Paws because Costco was partnered with them and we trust Costco). They stick to the fine print with religious zeal, going so far as to say that a nail injury to a dog (injured when he slipped on the icy sidewalk) is on the same paw as a blister that he'd had 4 years ago so that somehow is a preexisting condition. I am quite certain that if a dog choked on a ball and we had to take them to the vet, they would say "well, he has allergies so this is a preexisting condition because it deals with his air passage".

Put simply, Figo looks like a great deal because their premiums are lower than a lot of their competition, but they can afford to keep their premiums low because rarely do they every pay out. If they were a person and my neighbor, I would not trust them to watch my child, even for a minute.
title: Figo Never Pays Claims - Fine Print Warriors

I spent hours downloading and collecting all the information they requested.  There are better companies out there.  Do your research and don't waste your money.

text:
I have carried FIGO on my bulldog since she was a puppy. It is expensive! Especially her breed and it goes up every year as she gets older. She is going on 4 years old. Some years I never met the deductible and thought what a waste, do I really need insurance? Which was good, that meant she was healthy. Other years I was very glad I had it paid in full. She had two emergency health issues, one life or death. I was comfortable knowing that a $ was not the deciding factor if she would come home or not. When I was in the waiting room wondering if she would make it, I would have given the world to have her back in my arms. So if I have to scrimp and save, brown bag it, and work overtime to keep her healthy and insured, I am willing to pay the price. Sacrifices have to be made for those you love. 

There are so many different options available, everyone should be able to find a plan they can afford. Customer service is always willing to crunch numbers and run different scenarios with you to find a plan with our budget. They take time with you and don't pressure you to buy more than you can afford. It takes some time, some thought, and budgeting but you will be glad you have a little help in the end.  

I have never had a claim denied, just put on "hold" waiting for clarification notes from the vet. Customer service has always replied within 24 hours and claims are paid quickly. I have found FIGO support to be helpful, compassionate, and professional both on the phone and through emails. 

The only con is... the premiums. They go up every year (with her age) by $300+ a year.
title: I have carried FIGO on my bulldog since…

I got a big middle finger, so sorry, thanks for the money, you’re on your own. No compassion, no help. They made sure that the “policy” was written just so, symptoms appeared and they won’t help cover anything. What’s the point of insurance if they won’t help when it’s needed? But they are making millions from their customers. This has been the WORST experience, absolutely no help when we needed. All appeals have been denied. Would never recommend such a cold/heartless business. Future pups will be covered by other insurance providers.

Not to mention, I can't go to another company because my pet's conditions will be considered preexisting. I trusted Figo with my pet's coverage, and they seriously let me down. text:
Our puppy had a severe, life-threatening infection in August. We submitted $6000 of invoices, with full documentation. We received a reply to send them every ER visit, lab results, and regular Veterinary visits he had ever had (regardless if related or not). We confirmed they had the correct contact info for our vet, and confirmed that all records were available from them. Then nothing.  I checked online today. They claim is closed. No payout. No contact, explanation, or communication from Figo.

Be afraid. I am a (human) doctor and deal with insurance companies every day. This is not how they should work.  Don't expect to get your money from Figo. Or an explanation. Or anything other than an excuse to not pay you. If they communicate with you at all.
title: $6000 claim not paid. No explanation

text:
Do not buy FIGO pet insurance. There are many other options available. I chose FIGO because Costco added them as a preferred outside vendor.  I thought I could trust Costco to filter out the bad companies. Wrong.

Let me start by saying that the FIGO website and app are very easy to use. This is the only good thing about FIGO.

During the 14 day waiting period, unfortunately,  my puppy began a  prolonged period of diarrhea, coughing, lethargy, no food or liquid intake. I decided to have the vet check him. I could not point to a root cause and did not want to spend hundreds of dollars on diagnostics. The vet treated the symptoms with an injection of fluid and anti-vomiting meds. All of this I knew wouldn't be covered by insurance because there was a $250 deductible. It didn't matter to me that this was during the waiting period. My puppy was very sick.

Fast forward 6 weeks, my now 11 month old pup is exposed to canine influenza at daycare. Daycare sent a notice to all it's clients that they are waiting for the results, but they suspect a coughing dog was infected with canine influenza during the time my pup was boarded. A few days later, my dog began uncontrollable coughing, spitting up, loss of appetite, and lethargy. When I took him for a vet exam, we talked about his likely exposure to canine influenza. Thus, I waived the expensive tests and agreed to treat the symptoms. Four days later, his symptoms continued as his health declined even further. I had to pick him up to move him from room to room.  I went to the vet again for a recheck. My pup received fluids again and also an appetite stimulant. The vet concurred that my pup was highly likely infected with canine influenza since there had been other dogs presenting the same symptoms. Los Angeles County health confirmed this outbreak.  

(As a side bar, I used the  "chat with a live vet" feature on FIGO. Useless. The vet offered nothing of substance. In fact, based on the symptoms, the vet said I should take my pup to see a vet.)

FIGO denied these claims. FIGO said these episodes were a continuation of pre-existing conditions. While it is true that coughing and loss of appetite were common symptoms the first and second times,  the CAUSE of each illness was unrelated.  When does a perfectly healthy pup who was cleared by the vet as being so a few months earlier during his wellness exam, now become classified chronically ill?

I discussed this with a customer service rep twice. I mentioned that daycare issued a notice to all it's clients about the suspected canine influenza outbreak. She said she would forward this notice to the adjuster for reconsideration.

If I have to go to this length to prove my pup was sick and needed care, then what exactly does FIGO cover?  Based on my experience, FIGO won't ever cover an illness with noted cough, loss of appetite, lethargy, and diarrhea symptoms.

Folks, don't waste your money. There are other well-established insurers who provide better insurance coverage.
title: Do not buy FIGO pet insurance

I WAS EXPECTING THAT THEY WILL COVER AT LEAST SOME TESTS OR MEDICATION IN ORDER TO IDENTIFY THE CAUSE OF THE DISEASE.

text: I have paid a small fortune to Figo over the years for my 3 dogs. Every single time there's a claim, they want more information, SOAP notes, then the SOAP notes aren't detailed enough for them, so you have to go back to the vet and ask that these busy busy people update their notes just to satisfy FIGO. My most recent experience was a simple case of bad diarrhea that had afflicted my dog for a few days. The vets notes stated this, the invoice reflected the medication he was given to control it, yet FIGO still wanted more information. Avoid them like the plague, put your premiums into a savings account and you won't need them, won't need to pay their ridiculous deductibles and best of all won't have to deal with their deliberate making any claim an arduous process.

I tried to do this on their website, went through all the steps only to get a message that the claim could not be processed and to call a phone number. Tried again with the same result. You can't start to fill out a claim and save it- i.e. if you input the date, fill in the details of what happened, and have your invoice but not notes from the vet yet, you can't save any info you have uploaded- you have to do the entire thing later when you have all the documentation. So far I'm frustrated and not impressed at what should be a simple, straightforward process.

Thanks, Figo, thanks a lot for screwing us over. I hope your company and your new underwriters choke on the profits they are making. You should be ashamed.

text: I cannot find the words to fully praise Figo Pet Insurance, but I’ll try my best. I have a (just turned) 4 year old Pug. Her name is Bug. The day I brought her home, I got pet insurance for her through Figo. I knew I was going to go with Figo because I did much research and found they had the best reviews/reports through CR and the BBB and at a very reasonable monthly cost. (I chose the $10,000 yearly coverage with 90% reimbursement.) Fast forward to 3 1/2 years later. She started having mid-back to hind feet spasms regularly. She wouldn’t/couldn’t walk and was attacking her back paws as if they didn’t belong to her. If I tried to touch them, she would attack my hands. This is very unlike her, as she’s not a biter. Off to the vet for X-rays, but nothing was found. They suspected nerve issues. After 2 months of weekly acupuncture, canine massage, PEMF treatments, and 4 different meds 2x/day, she wasn’t really getting better. So off we went to the neurologist for an MRI. Turns out Bug has a congenital condition that affects her spinal cord from the thoracic area on down. She’s holding her own now on all the correct medications and an at-home exercise program. Figo has lived up to their reputation and exceeded it, in my opinion! I could never have afforded all of her treatments without them. Plus it’s so easy! I use the app to file her claims for her vet fees, medications, etc. Within 3-5 business days, 90% of what I paid out is directly deposited back into my bank account. My baby, Bug, means the world to me, and without Figo I would never have been able to afford her medical care. I’m so happy I made the choice to go with Figo Pet Insurance 4 years ago. I’ve even recommended Figo to friends and clients, who have chosen, and are extremely satisfied with, Figo as well.
title: I cannot find the words to fully praise…

text: Submitted a claim in Jan-2021 for cherry-eye on 1 year old puppy.  Denied because I called the vet 8 months prior to being seen for the issue and asking about it over the phone. The phone inquiry was added as a medical record, so Figo claimed it as a pre-existing condition. First they said it was a denied due to vet diagnosis. The vet provided a letter that it was not a diagnosis and that it was merely a phone conversation/inquiry. Figo responded to said letter saying that it was declined due to 'clinical signs'. No one with a clinical background saw the issue until the day of surgery. So they are saying that me inquiring over the phone 8 months prior constitutes 'clinical signs'. I had no idea that I was qualified as a vet tech/veterinarian. Do not use Figo, they are a racket and don't have any intention of paying out any claims. Pathetic.
title: Claim Denied via Loophole/Extreme Contract Language

text: This policy has been an utter sham and I wish we had gone with another pet insurance policy. Over the last few months her new vet has identified a range of issues (ear infection, itchy flakey skin requiring a prescription shampoo, bloodwork, urine tests, x-rays for a limp we noticed when she went up stairs, prescription diet for kidney issues from the bloodwork results...) It's been difficult enough for us as it is trying to help our new dog deal with medical issues, and it's been all the worse knowing we paid over $500 for Figo's "preferred plan" pet health insurance while they have systematically refused to partially pay or even consider a single dollar we've spent against our deductible. I could see maybe denying one or two issues, but it's utterly unacceptable to say after thousands of dollars of vet bills that Figo's pet health insurance would refuse to cover a single dollar. I cannot stress enough how shady this company is. Do NOT open a plan with then if you expect them to actually help cover any medical expenses that arise.

title: FIVE STARS

text:
We initially loved Figo, especially because we insured our cat later in life, and not a lot of pet insurance companies offer decent pet insurance when the pets are older. Figo (or at least our policy) was originally underwritten by Markel. When they were bought out by Independence America (last year or two), they literally tripled our premium at the renewal date, and substantially reduced the benefits and also created a huge spike in our deductible. Plus, the customer service during that transition was very uneducated and not very helpful. That alone was very disappointing. 

But then, they became incredibly focused on scrutinizing each claim to find a reason to not pay it. Any loophole they can find, they leverage it. I have had to appeal two separate claims and even with letters from the vet, indicating why the treatment fell under my policy’s terms, they don’t budge - or budge very minutely, but not enough to really make a difference. 

Also, some of the terms make no sense. For example, they don’t cover oral surgery, at all - even if it’s due to an illness or disease. Our cat has an oral mass that needed to be removed and in order to remove the mass, they had to remove the tooth. Figo decided not to cover the entire surgery because they claim that it was oral surgery to do a tooth extraction. They said they would only cover it, if it was an accident/injury - not an illness. But the main reason that we get pet insurance is to cover illness, diseases, etc. This simply doesn’t make sense to me. 

And now, they are not paying things that they had paid a few months ago (still same policy year). It’s super sad and discouraging to pour so much into premiums and deductibles, only to find them constantly finding loopholes to not pay the claims. 

We have Healthy Paws for our other 3 creatures - literally Thank God. HP is the absolute best pet insurance company, and are very generous in their claim reviews and payments, and take their customers at their word, placing a high value on customer care / service. If you’re going to invest in pet insurance, skip Figo, for sure. Choose Healthy Paws.
title: Skip Figo - Go with Healthy Paws

I was told I had to supply the name and number of my dog’s breeder! Supply dates for every specialist Rudy had ever seen with chart notes. To top it off I was given 3 days to supply this information to keep the claim open. Figo is the same as every other pet insurance I have tried. They deny every claim. Too bad there is no regulation of this industry. My advice is to save the money you would have spent on pet insurance to use if need arises.

text: Figo is incredible. We love how quick they are in response to anything and everything. It is so easy to connect with them to reach a better understanding! They are quick to get claims up and running as well as the reimbursement.
title: Figo is incredible

text:
Firstly, I want to say that I wish I had researched any bad reviews years ago before I ever signed up with FIGO. It seems that others are in the same boat as I am! I have been a loyal customer of FIGO for approximately 4-5 years now. I have NEVER needed to use the insurance however, I continually paid my monthly premium on auto-pay (by now, thousands of dollars total). I initially went with them because one always worries about getting coverage for pre-existing conditions whether it be minor or major and they seem to have stated they had a good policy with regards to considering a pre-existing condition something that has happened within the last 18 months. Well, for the first time in a while, I had to bring my cat to the vet as he had a small lump on his jawline... I wound up spending a little over $400 however, I was glad to know in the back of my mind that I had EXPENSIVE coverage for Koby's medical needs. Guess what? They only paid my visit fee and denied everything else(did not pay it really, it went toward my exorbitant yearly deductible)!!!! First of all, it even states on the explanation of benefits that, "Any illness or other condition that first occurred or displayed any signs and/or symptoms consistent with the stated illness or condition within 18 months prior to the pet policy effective date or prior to the expiration of any applicable waiting period"... Ok, I called customer service, maybe this was a mistake. I asked for an explanation and the rep confirmed that Koby had a lump on his lip back in 2013 so it is considered pre-existing.. wait a minute, what is the whole thing about the 18 months prior to starting an insurance policy with them? (2013 was over 2-3 years before I ever signed up with FIGO!).. I was told basically, read the fine print in our policy.. Ok, not only this but in 2013 he was brought to the vet for a swollen ball on the tip of his lip (allergic reaction to his food bowl - plastic).. as soon as we changed his bowl to metal, it went away and never came back. Now in 2020, he had a lump on the side of his jawbone and it will not be covered. This just sounds too funny to me. Every year, your premium goes up and goes up quite a bit at that. Like I said, I have paid A LOT in the past few years each month to ensure I have coverage for my cat. WHAT A WASTE OF MONEY!!!!!! I could have literally put that money away each month as if I were contributing to an emergency vet fund for any vet bills I would need to pay in the future and I would have been completely fine. It is so sad to see that they can easily take your money every month, increase your monthly premium each year, and then deny your claims and pay close to NOTHING. This is not the first time they have disappointed me however. Obviously, I was upset about the increases in monthly prices each year but whatever, you cannot do anything about that especially if you want to ensure your pet has coverage (or so you think they would anyway), but I was grandfathered into 100% reimbursement along with a $200 deductible. Well, this recent and current policy, I was raised to a $500 deductible and unable to keep my $200 one.. It is very clear that they do not care much about your pet or about your financial situations/the reason why you prefer to pay for coverage. Again, I am really saddened to know my money that I worked so hard for is wasted and gone, for nothing. I had to pay the entire bill and the little sixty something exam fee they did cover, it went toward my big $500 deductible anyway (LOL!). Please - take this from someone who has been with FIGO for years, paid tons of money in premiums and NEVER used them within that time period up until this year....SAVE YOUR MONEY AND YOUR ENERGY!!! Put away some money every month (or every paycheck) toward an emergency vet fund for yourself (as if you were paying a monthly premium, only to yourself). This way, when you have a vet bill to pay, you will have this money already saved. Another option, get CARE CREDIT.. You never want to invest in something that you will forever be uncertain about. I pay for FIGO insurance and I get close to nothing in return from them. Absolutely terrible.. still in shock that I am at a loss. I really did have high hopes for this company and their services but I must have been sadly mistaken. Just to reiterate : SAVE YOUR TIME and YOUR MONEY.

Update 12/28/2020: I officially canceled my policy and it is a relief. After leaving my review, I was contacted by some sort of customer satisfaction manager (something like that?).. Basically, they just keep explaining the same thing over and over again, defending their decisions.. that is fine. I replied to the email immediately requesting some information in which I was never provided. Already started putting away my "monthly premium" into savings toward a vet emergency fund! I recommend you all do the same :)
title: HORRIBLE - DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY

text:
I don’t know where to start. We adopted a 4 year old English Bulldog earlier in the year. The poor dog was living in a van, rescued by a  local bulldog group and shuffled between foster homes all his life until we found each other. 
From past pet ownership
history I told myself years ago that if I ever get another pet I will have pet insurance on him/her. 
After 2 days of research and comparison to other pet insurance companies I decided to go with Figo... honestly, never thinking that I would need it. I chose a premium policy with a $500 deductible and 100% reimbursement and no annual claim cap at $62/month. 
Now the health problems began to arise...Less than 4 months after adopting Tobi he began to walk with instability and seemed to fall over when trying to lay down.  Noticeably after that he began losing the use of his back legs and then shortly after that his front legs began to give out.  In less than a weeks time he was not able to stand up by himself or stand up without assistance at all.  
I took him to our long-time family vet and upon review it seemed that his condition was severe, and the treatment that he required was beyond their scope of service so I was referred to a local animal hospital ( an animal hospital, not just a Vets office).

Long story short.... after X-rays, MRI’s and a spinal tap my poor boy had lesions on his brain and on his spinal cord at the C-1 & 2 vertebrae.  His condition worsened and the neurologist made one last attempt to treat him with a chemotherapy drug.  The treatment worked and Tobi was released from the hospital after a long weeks stay.  

The final bill was over $12,000 dollars!!!

I filed the claim, which is such an easy process with Figo and submitted all the requested paperwork.  
Here I am thinking that I’ve paid less than $200 in total insurance premiums and am now asking for a $12k reimbursement.  
There was no argument, no nit-picking or any challenge to my claim.  It was paid in a timely manner based on my policy coverage and terms.  ( I really thought that my wife was going to have to sell a kidney to pay off the bill but thankfully that didn’t happen. J/K )
I would HIGHLY RECOMMEND Figo based on the following:
-Customer service
-Policy types and flexibility
-Competitive rates
-Easy of claim filing
-Overall satisfaction. 

My boy is 100% back to health and we are both as happy as we can be together.
title: FIGO all the way!!!!

text: Actual scam, heartless, fraudulent company! Buyer beware ! If you look at all these recent review giving them five stars all reviewers have 1 review only. It is very obvious that they are doing some kind of promotion with new customers in a bid to change consumers negative views about them, but DO NOT BELIVE IT! Soon these reviewers will see and be sickened like I am.  I have trusted and loved this insurance company for far too long only to be treated in return with yearly price increases, decreases in coverage, and denials in coverage at every turn! Their new revised policies description of a “pre existing condition” very literally states “A condition may be considered Pre-existing: whether or not it was specifically diagnosed by a veterinarian, whether or not it was treated by a veterinarian, is in remission at the time of application, is seasonal in nature even if in remission at the time of application, is currently or previously being controlled by medication(s) ect” it goes on an on. I challenge you to find something they could not find a loop hole for to make it pre existing when their new policy actually states it can be considered pre existing whether or not it was diagnosed or treated by your veterinarian. Are you joking me?  My dogs were both rescue animals age 2 and 1 when they started on insurance so they already had some previous vet history. This is not a good thing when this company is looking to connect dots that don’t even exist to make everything pre existing, and no amount of Dr’s notes or info will change their minds. Also, it is ridiculous to say you are “transparent” with your price increases and subsequent coverage decreases by sending you email saying “theese are your renewal options” and if you don’t like it, well, too bad. They could care less and don’t let them make you think any different. I have a two year and four year old dog and pay over $140 per month. I can’t imagine how much this would be costing me if my dogs were seniors. Also, your options are basically to either renew with them or just hope your dog doesn’t get ill, because now everything your dog has ever had or is ever even mentioned in the doctors personal notes ( insurance will get them, believe me) is a “pre existing condition”. They know they have you over a barrel and this is why they are getting away with these price Increases. I have filed a review with the better business bureau and will file an actual claim for mitigation if necessary, since they can’t seem to find any reason to pay their part for my dogs necessary surgery, only every fraudulent reason they won’t. SICKENING!
title: Actual scam!

text: I have had a great experience with Figo Pet Insurance.  They cover what they say they do and are usually quite fast on sending a reimbursement check.  The premiums are reasonable when you think about what they cover.  In the past after we moved states a couple of mistakes were made in changing my dogs to new policies when it was time to renew. title: I have had a great experience with Figo…

text:
I signed up for Figo in 2017 and up until recently had no complaints. I've never had to file a claim, I happily accepted the reasonable increase to my premium in 2018 for my "Senior" Dog when he turned 8, and even chose to increase my coverage in 2019 just to be on the safe the side! 

This week I received an email notifying me my policy was up for renewal, but because Figo has recently changed underwriters my monthly premium has TRIPLED, my deductible has DOUBLED, and my reimbursement amount has gone down by 20%.  

The email they sent even says they think the increase of over 50% is unacceptable, however they are willing to do NOTHING about it. It literally reads: "Since your upcoming policy will be underwritten by IAIC, not all coverages/plans or prices match exactly from your previous plan. However, your increase this year may exceed 50%, and we find this to be unacceptable. In order to make this transition easier for you and to find the best coverage available for a similar price with IAIC, we are providing you a recommended options"

I had the unlimited plan, I paid a $48.44 a month premium, with a $500 Deductible and 90% Reimbursement. The new *RECOMMENDED* Plan comes with a $129.44 Monthly Premium, $1,000 Deductible, and 70% Reimbursement. 

??? Seriously???
The best possible option you could come up with was to triple what I was paying before with less coverage? If that's the going rate for the market then that's fine, I have no problem paying a fair price for a decent product. But as a business it is your responsibility to come up with a long term strategy to increase over time and not make your customers feel like they are being taken advantage of. An increase of that significance should happen in small increments over time and not triple over night. I have emailed my request to cancel my policy immediately and already signed up with a new provider who I will be happily paying $110 a month for the same coverage I had before with Figo. 

It's not all about the money - It's about how you treat your customers. Enjoy the 3 years of pure profit you made on me. I will not recommend your company to anyone.
title: Bad Business - Tripled My Premiums & Lessened my Reimbursement overnight

text:
Figo is not a good pet insurance company and I wouldn't be comfortable recommending it to my friends and family. When I was first shopping for pet insurance I ran across a ton of negative reviews accusing Figo of doing a bait and switch, where the first year's policy is reasonably priced but then it doubles the next year. I asked a Figo customer service rep if that actually happened and she denied it. It was one of those situations where either the rep had been lied to or she was lying to me, neither of which is good. She recommended that I request a quote for my pet but aged one year older to see how my premium would increase after one year. That seemed fair, so i did that. The increase was from $48 to $54 and that seemed fair so I bought the policy. 

They messed up the first claim. They applied the office fee toward my deductible even though i hadn't paid for that option. I called them to let them know of the mistake. They were embarrassed, which is the correct response. It is embarrassing to be an insurance company and not know how to process your own claim. 

At some point during my first year, the company announced that they were changing underwriters because they got so many complaints about doubling premiums (guess that was true after all). When I moved from Phoenix, AZ to a small town in Minnesota and went to renew my policy, they wanted to increase my premium from $48 to $68. I called to ask why there was such a big increase and they said it was because I had moved and vet care is more expensive in my new location. In what universe is pet care more expensive in a small midwestern town than it is in ANY large metropolitan area? I HATE being lied to by companies so I found a new pet insurance company. Plus, the deductible increased from 1000 to 1500 and I lost some other benefits I cant remember right now, but they wanted more money for it.

 I cancelled my Figo account  and received an email confirming cancellation.  The next month they still charged me the premium. At that point I was in the middle of changing banks and had a minimal amount of money in my old bank acct, which was linked to Figo. The payment overdrew my bank account. They refused to cover the charges.

So ask yourself this... if you're in the middle of a medical emergency with your pet, who may be the love of your life, will you be able to trust a company that has repeatedly lied to you and been unable to follow their own claim procedures? Can you really trust them to be there for you and your pet in time of desperate need? I don't want to be in the position of having to choose to put down my pet because I cant afford the treatment because my pet insurance company can't get itself together. Me, I'll go with a company that's better established, doesn't outright lie to me, and knows what it's doing.

Two stars instead of one because the price was good for that first year and bc they do respond really quickly when you contact them.
title: There are way better companies out there

text:
I'm unhappy that Figo has chosen a new company to underwrite their policies. I'm even more unhappy that pre-existing users were not given the option to be grandfathered into their old plan, but instead were forced to swap. 

Under the new plan(s): 

- Emergency exam fees are not automatically covered,
- There is no option for the old $200 deductible, and 
- The 90% reimbursement rate is roughly 25% more expensive than it was previously (for me, although I'm reading here that it has near doubled for some).

Ultimately I'll keep Figo because I do appreciate how quickly claims are handled and their customer service response time is unparalleled, but I am disappointed with how they've chosen to roll out this change.

text:
I, like several other reviewers here, recently experienced a huge increase in premium (3x), an increase in deductible from 200 to 500, and lowered coverage 80% to 70%.  In order to get the same coverages and deductible going forward, I would need to pay 300 total per month, from 72 (for two dogs)!  I correct myself, that is more than a 4x increase!!  

I've read their responses to other reviewers, that the previous underwriter was increasing premiums year to year, and at least for me, that is NONSENSE! I had only received increases of 5 dollars or less per year per pet which seemed reasonable given their advancing age.  

But this recent change?? NOT OK! What a horrible way to treat loyal customers especially those who have made very few claims. Shame on you Figo, with your nonsense excuses and rationalizations!!  

Perhaps Figo lowered premiums for some owners/pets, but there's a definitive pattern emerging here among reviewers.  If premiums were significantly raised only for the 'senior pets', to eliminate the risk by making it entirely illogical financially for the owner, or unaffordable, then that is truly despicable!! 

I will never ever recommend them again to people nor will I ever consider them for ANY future pets that I own.

text: Three years later since my fist review and what a noteable decline in coverage and customer service. I never had any issues with their old underwriter.  I guess I was one of the few lucky ones. New underwriters coverage is not as encompassing as the old one. I get it...times change and focuses change...sometimes not in the interest of the consumer. As in all businesses profit is the bottom line. But their customer service has also declined. "Well, I'm not sure and Umm, I don't know" now are standard responses.  The only exceptions have been my interactions with Susan, Anne, and to some extent Jenna. I was becoming very frustrated on the call with Jenna and dropped an F-bomb. I apologized more than once but I could "feel" her coldness through the phone. She was helpful and did get my questions answered, but take it from someone who has done customer service for at least 30 years, you gotta get a little tougher skin and not always take things to heart in customer service. Only three words to describe my experiences with Susan and Anne -- "above and beyond". Those two always calm, cool, and collected and their first reply was not ... I don't know.  They got the answers. Hopefully Figo will return back to it's stellar service it once provided before this recent change -- and don't lose Susan nor Anne. Thank you.

text: When I first signed up with this company, I gave them stellar reviews; however, things have gone downhill. This company lured me in with very low rates for pet insurance for all 3 of my dogs. After 2 years there was a significant increase in premium that raised my cost by almost $200 a year. They explained it was due to my premiums being too low compared to the national average and they needed to be raised. At this point, my dog was sick and I just kept the insurance. The following year there wasn't a large increase and they assured me that they wouldn't have a significant increase like that again. Fast forward 3 years later and they have changed underwriters. Now my premium has increased by $10-$15 per dog, raising my premium by $380 a year. At renewal, the company hid this significant increase by lowering my dogs coinsurance from 80% to 70% without my authorization. They said they did this automatically to not have my premiums raise significantly. When I asked them to change my policy back to what I authorized (what I signed up for) I then saw this large increase to my insurance rates. Had I not read my declaration page very closely, I would not have noticed this small change to my policy and wouldn't have seen this increase in premium. This is being done during the covid-19 pandemic and most insurance companies are offering discounts to their clients. Figo, is changing your policy design without your consent to hide the insanely large increase to your premiums. This company uses unethical business practices to lure you in with very low rates, knowing that after 4 years your dogs will have been to the vet several times and anything your dog has been to the vet for,  another pet insurance company with not cover because it will be considered a pre-existing condition. Figo let me know that if I cancelled my policy, no other insurance company would cover my dogs cancer treatment. So either I pay the new high premium or just create a savings account to save an emergency fund for my dogs.
title: New underwriter in 2020 ruining this company

text:
I am so ashamed of myself for signing up for this pet insurance. I have been paying on my policy for almost a year. I needed to file a claim for my cat as she was throwing up. I took her to the vet hospital they really did not find anything wrong with her. They did give her some medicine as they felt she may be having a problem with defecating. My cat had this problem around 3 years ago but the vet did not find anything that was causing this. She said she may have eaten something that caused this. Of course, when I submitted my claim to FIGO they denied it as they stated that this was a precondition that was not covered. My total vet bill was $932. I agreed to the additional testing as I thought I was covered under this insurance plan. Big mistake!!!! When I called the lady would not provide me the legal address to provide to my attorney nor would she provide me anyone else to speak with. She stated that she was the only person in the office. I asked to speak with her manager and of course, they were not available. This is a typical insurance response when they do not want to payout. She kept tel me that they do payout for services and recently paid a $20,000 claim. HA HA HA, what was that the one claim for the year and this has been added to your script to defuse customers? Cats get sick and mine does about every 6 months or so but it passes. Their response was as follows:  "Cat has a history of intermittent vomiting and constipation over the last 2 years. She has episodes about every 6 months where she will be straining to defecate and will produce either nothing or large dry fecal balls. She always vomits and cries during the days when she is sick.
Chronic intermittent vomiting, constipation, anorexia, +/- diarrhea" But this is not covered as they consider this as a precondition prior to taking out my policy. Again, they have no intention of paying anything out and they expect their payment every month on time. Think the only way you could get a claim is that it has to be a newborn with no problems and then maybe they will payout something but like most insurance companies they will find a loophole. Please I beg you not to make the same mistake I did. I am so ashamed and embarrassed I allowed myself to be taken advantage of. Follow up on their reply: please see how they act like they care but as you can tell this is a typical insurance companies response. They all try to act so concerned but really they just want that monthly premium. Please don’t be fooled by their response. Save your money and go with a different company. I have learned my lesson that’s for sure.
