text:
First, when shopping for pet insurance you will find that Figo, hands down, provides THE most flexibility in policy customization. Once you select your coverage level (yes there are options!) you can choose from several combinations of annual deductible, annual payout limit, and percentage of coverage. Figo is also one of the only (if not THE only) pet insurance companies to offer both an unlimited annual payout option and a 100% coverage option on claims (most max out at 90%). 

So let's talk claims... I have three cats and a dog and unfortunately have had to use my pet insurance on more than a few occasions (no worries they are all fine now). Simple. Basically just upload images of the bill then wait... and not for long. The quickest turnaround between submitting a claim and confirmation of coverage was 14 minutes. No $h*t. I think the longest may have been one business day. Then just a few days until the money hits your account. 

One more thing - cost. I have spent the time and have done the research on I believe every pet insurance company in existence (I can spend time doing that because I have no human children). Figo has the most competitive rates for the coverage. Period. 

I know this is a very wordy review but there are very few things that I am this passionate about. I am very grateful for this insurance and tell everyone about it that will listen. I could not recommend it more. 

Thank you.

text:
IF I could give this company zero stars I would. I am a veterinarian and have insured my personal pets with figo for the past 3 years.  Yes the price hikes are outrageous, however Fine go did cover the cost whenever my pets were sick and needed additional care above what I could provide for them (which is a lot, I had 3 older pets).  My problem with this pet insurance began when my beloved Winnie passed away unexpectedly due to complications from chemotherapy in July 2019.  I was devastated.  I admit it took me a long time (6months) to submit the paperwork for reimbursement as I was grieving (still am). 
Figo refuses to reimburse me due to the fact that Winnie’s policy annually renewed on July 11 (even though I paid faithfully every month).  Figo claims I had 90 days after july 11 to make a claim on the previous annual policy.  When I finally submitted the claim in 12/2019 I only received payment for the July 17th bill.  I contacted figo two weeks later and was told they just did not scroll down and will process the two claims from July 8 & 9th.  Another two weeks go by and still no reimbursement.  I contacted figo again and they FINALLY explained that they are not going to reimburse me because the annual renewal date of July 11, (you only have 90 days after that to make a claim from the previous policy year).  First,  of all we are talking about a matter of 3 days and I always made the monthly payments.  I would understand if I canceled the insurance than asked for reimbursement.  Second, I feel like they strung me along by initially saying they just didn’t scroll down on the email and see the additional claims.  Third, agent Shea kept saying the underwriter would not let them pay.  Well if that’s true why did they string me along.  Fourth, I have submitted claims a few months after and it was never a problem, I was never advised there was a time limit for claims.  Winnie happened to get sick at the end of her policy and that’s why Figo does not want to pay, that’s duplicitous.  If she had gotten sick a few days later this would not have been an issue and my claim would have been reimbursed.  
I love my pets & insured them to get the best care possible without financial limitations, I never asked for reimbursement on the months I paid after Winnie’s death, it was the last thing I had to hold on to.  Additionally Figo will not let me appeal the decision, but would not explain why.
SHAME ON YOU FIGO for not allowing your customers to grieve over the loss of their pet (Winnie was my first dog and like my child)!  Unfortunately I have to continue to use Figo for my two other pets (Nala & Bailey), they have too many diagnosed comorbidities to switch insurance companies as most pet insurance companies do not cover pre existing conditions.  
When I am ready to adopt a new dog I will be looking at other pet insurance companies such as pets best, trupanion or nationwide.  As previously stated I am a veterinarian and will not be recommending Figo pet insurance to clients.  I am also considering legal action!  BEWARE of figo pet insurance they are devious!  
******response to Figo Pet Insurance reply: According to your policy I have 6 months to submit a claim.  I didn’t realize figo would put in exceptions to their policy ie.  only 90 days to submit a claim from renewal policy period or 90 days after a pets death.  So I guess my pet can’t get sick at the end of the policy period.  Second you did not even address the fact that your agents strung me along with the first call regarding my claim & the fact that figo did not notify me that my claim was denied.  I feel I was strung along so I couldn’t make an appeal. Third it took a poor review for Figo to adhere to their own policy and reimburse me the money I paid on Winnie’s policy after her death.  Fourth, stop using the underwriter as a scapegoat, Figo picked the underwriter. I am a vet and  DO NOT RECOMMEND FIGO PET INSURANCE their polices have to many catch-22s.
title: IF I could give this company zero stars…

text:
***Update 1/13/2020

I noticed that Figo also has my policy effective date incorrect as 12/28/2019 when I had been a paying customer since 2018.. I'm assuming this is one of the reason why they try to state my dog's vet's visits as'pre existing' and refused to cover the fees. I've had a chat with my vet and she too was confident that the fees from the clinic should have been covered by most credential insurance providers. 

Policy Holder:	FGO10000068866

I've had a terrible experience with Figo. It came highly recommended through a friend so I signed up and became a member in mid 2018. 

During Christmas 2019, my dog, who had been perfectly healthy all her life throughout all her vet visits, started coughing strangely and we found specks of blood on her snout. We quickly took her to the vet and had the clinic send the insurance claim for the veterinary bills.

The whole process took over 2 weeks with Figo closing, re-opening my claim, disappearing for days and requesting more and more my pet's previous records since her birth..
I managed to send them all the records from vets we had visited which clearly shows that *Karlie had no know issues.* 

And once all seems to be set, all my claims were denied and not a single cent was covered with Figo using 'pre-existing conditions' for all her expenses regarding this new symptom thatstarted in Dec 2019. I felt robbed knowing that my healthy dog has never had any issues before and having had Figo insurance for 2 years, they won't cover anything by claiming her condition was pre-existing while it was only discovered 2 weeks ago by the vet, after 1.5 years after being a Figo customer.

At the end of the day, I feel robbed by Figo. It's not what I expected it would be.

text:
(Please read)Beware, do not get this “insurance” they are scammers. This is a robbery on broad day light. Got the policy with Figo and when the policy kicked in August  I took my puppy to the vet, and he had a heart murmur, some Pomeranian dogs have them, doctor said it could be nothing but it could lead to something worst or it could go away, anyway this is a congenital disease. Unfortunately it led to an an enlarged heart and had to go to an emergency vet on October 25th. I also payed more so I can have coverage for vet bills, and they refused to PAY!!!! My Pomeranian has to have surgery and they didn’t want to pay also because they said It fell under the 14 day no Illness period or some crap like that. They       asked every document they we had for our dog. And they didn’t want to cover. On their website they have misleading information saying that they could have exceptions if the certified vet would send a letter But his was a congenital disease which this was!!!! also they told me that on the phone. THEY SHOULD COVER CONGENITAL DISEASES which this was the Case. My vet and the cardiologist send a very convincing letter and and she also spoke with them on the phone A COUPLE OF TIMES they REFUSE TO PAY as well as this point  all I wanted is my puppy to have surgery and I had to put it on my credit card. I had to pay more than $6000 which I’m still trying to pay. My dog passed away in surgery On Nov 7th, we are still heart broken and we miss him every day. 
Figo when they replied denying to pay used a very normal language with no medical terms but, last email I got from them it FELT LIKE AN INSULT!!! They transformed the letter that the cardiologist and the vet send them to change a few thing now speaking with medical terms like PDA and stuff like that. They are full of crap turning tables on their favor. Even when my Vet from the specialty center and cardiologist called them and sent emails to them, they were looking always for a way out. They wanted to talk to the fist vet that detected the murmur trying to find contradictions but they couldn’t find any!!! They still denied to pay. I tell people I know about this and they have lost customers cause these are really messed up. Life will get them in sure of that I believe that karma will get them and all the money they make out inocent beings like dogs and us their owners.

They charge the co-pay prior to applying the deductible, which, frankly, is ridiculous. It makes no sense that they should be reducing your out-of-pocket expense by the co-pay before applying it to your deductible. Lastly, they don't cover the cost of vet fees.

I'm honestly surprised they have as many customers as they do with a structure like this. I switched to another insurance company which will save me $20/mo, covers the cost of vet fees, and applies expenses to the deductible before co-pay. No brainer.

text:
I can honestly say without reservation that FIGO was the most important decision I made when we welcomed our two Yorkie puppies into our family.  We elected 100% coverage (an option not offered by most of not all of their competitors) for Cody and Lola. Throughout their first year as puppies they got into all types of trouble eating things they shouldn’t have and visits to the vet became more frequent than we’d like.  Every time we could get the treatment our pups needed without fear of not being able to afford the vet care.  
This past year we were devastated to find out Cody had a liver condition that would shorten and eventually take his life.  To get this news about our 2 year old baby was indescribable. We did our research and found that Animal Medical Center was the best place to go for the surgery Cody required. All in through the diagnostic tests, MRIs, CT scans, ICU stay and surgery the cost was to be over $10,000. Because of our FIGO coverage we could get the best care Cody needed and give him a fighting chance. I contacted FIGO and explained the situation and not only did they give us the confidence and pre-approval that the surgery would be covered they genuinely cared.  Mackenzie at FIGO followed up frequently checking on Cody and wishing him well. FIGO also paid the claim a few days after Cody’s surgery 
I can report that 2 weeks post-op Cody is almost fully recovered and will now live a full and healthy life. We owe our Cody’s life to the surgeons at AMC and without our FIGO coverage we would not have been able to save our puppy without financial hardship.

Thank you FIGO. We will be lifelong loyal customers.
title: FIGO saved our puppy’s life. Thank You!

text: So far, my experience with FIGO has been positive. I find the App to be very helpful for submitting claims. Most claims I have submitted have been approved and the coverage is decent. There was one claim that was denied, because my 3 month old puppy supposedly had the illness (Giardia) before the coverage period began. Since Giardia is considered 'curable', if she goes a year without symptoms, the illness will be removed from the 'preexisting' conditions list. I have found the customer service over the phone to be good (fast, knowledgeable, and genuine care). So far I would recommend FIGO; get it while your pet is young to make sure there are no 'preexisting' conditions that get excluded. I hope I never need to use my coverage for a major claim, but have piece of mind... just in case. Pet insurance is a MUST in my opinion.

Figo far exceeded my expectations. I have filed 4 claims, all were processed in less than a week and 2 were processed the same day. text:

It has truly been a blessing to have found an insurance company that really cares about and values dogs over profit. 

My family started the journey with Figo several years ago when we insured our first two dogs; Paisley & Skittles. From the very beginning we were treated with respect and charged fair prices. 

Earlier this year, Paisley became very sick and had to be treated at multiple emergency locations which ultimately culminated with her having to receive an emergency surgery that would save her life. I think that few dog owners ever really stop to think about just how expensive medical treatment can be for their loved pets. We certainly had not thought about it, and of course we had some reservations when it came to our experiences with human insurance companies. Needless to say, the medical bill for this treatment was extraordinarily expensive, but I'm happy to say that Figo was there for us and has since been there for our other pet; Skittles when she recently became ill.

My wife and I now have two other pets in the family; Ellie & Bailey and they are also insured with the best company in town. I know that should anything ever happen to them, Figo has my back, and to anyone who's considering this company for your loved ones, I highly recommend it and promise that it will be the best decision that you will make for your pet.

Thank you Figo!

text: I've had my pup since March and Figo insurance since April. He's a good and generally healthy pup, but we have had to take him to the vet 3 times since getting the insurance.  Each time, Figo has responded within 24 hours of receiving the claim. I really appreciate that the claims are broken down and each item is coded with the reason something has been or has not been included as a redeemable item.  We were not surprised when a piece of a vet invoice denied - and that has only one piece of a vet visit. Otherwise, the 90/10 plan ($200 deductible) has already more than paid for itself.
title: Excellent customer service and pays for itself

text:
I just joined Figo after hearing good things, but I have to say, my first experience with them has been pretty concerning and I'm considering changing to a different insurer already :( 

 Figo offers to waive the 6 month waiting period on any knee injuries if your vet examines the knees and finds them healthy. So I had my vet have examine my dog, and he wrote on her chart that he had examined all 4 legs including the joints and soft tissues, there were no abnormalities or indication of any problem. I uploaded this via the (very user friendly) app, and notified the company that I had done so. 

They responded very quickly which was good, but I was told that the veterinarian was supposed to say he has examined her knees - so by saying that he had examined 4 legs and found them all healthy, I hadn't fulfilled the criteria to have the 6 month waiting period waived. I found it almost funny, how many legs do they think my dog has?

Although this is an easy problem to fix, it's left me very concerned that there is no common sense approach and that if I ever have to make a claim I would risk having denied it based on loopholes and traps in the policy wording. If they are this particular when it comes to waiving a waiting period, how can I be sure they would make good on an actual claim?
title: lack of common sense vs policy wording

text:
I have had my dog, Bella, insured with Figo since I adopted her in 2016. I thought them a good company, but a recent situation proved how great they are.

Bella ate supplements containing xylitol which is toxic to dogs. As it may cause liver damage or glucose levels so low as to be fatal, it is an emergency situation. She required immediate treatment and 24 hour monitoring. The 24 hour facility, a veterinary hospital, estimated the cost to be approximately $1,000 per day if there were no complications. 

I called Figo and explained the situation. The claims representative explained how I could and what would be required to submit a claim for each day my dog was hospitalized so it could reviewed and processed.
 
Although my claims were submitted after hours, Figo processed each one within hours of the start of their business day. I was reimbursed for covered costs as expected less my deductible. I received  my reimbursement within days.

Excellent work, Figo, and a big thank you!
title: Great work Figo!

text: Complete waste of money. Did my homework and thought I had found the best insurance available for my pup. Called to confirm that his sensitive tummy would not be considered a pre-existing condition. He had never been diagnosed with a chronic condition, just bouts of diarrhea and vommiting that he completely recovered from. Was assured that this was not a pre-existing condition. Fast forward 3 months and I submitted a claim for 2 vet visits, one fir blood work and one with abdominal x-rays. Was given the run around for weeks. The claim would languish with no communication. When I called to see what was going on, they would tell me that they needed more documentation. The first time, the info was actually already in the pet cloud, but they "overlooked" it. Three more repeats of this cycle (no communication, me calling, them asking  for more information, me supplying the info) ensured. Finally, a determination was received from the company that no stomach issues would ever be covered for my dog as his stomach issues were a pre-existing condition. All staff members that I delat with were pleasant and helpful, but in the end, a garbage product and untruthful business practices make the insurance worthless to those with dogs who have any history of medical issues. Also have heard of outrageous premium increases after the first year. Steer clear.
title: Complete waste of money

I have nothing but good things to say about our experience with FIGO. When my fiance and I first rescued our 7 month old English Bulldog we were hesitant about getting insurance - we questioned whether anything would actually be covered, and whether or not it would just be a waste of money. Our vet insisted that we look into FIGO. After reviewing everything we decided that we would give it a shot, and boy was that one of the best decisions we've made.

FIGO has covered all of our pups unexpected vet visits (as long as it wasn't preexisting) - from a dog bite, to eye injuries and now an upcoming surgery that our dog needs. There's no way we would have been able to afford all of the vet bills if it hadn't been for FIGO.
title: FIGO to the rescue

title: First time through the claims process…

text:
Lack of communication and follow up.

Our English Bulldog had to have a surgery to rectify his soft palate. 
The surgery was in November of 2017. We filed the claim with all needed information- previous vet records, billing from surgery and notes made by the doctor who performed the surgery. 
4-6 weeks later, we finally get an email the claims been closed with zero payment. We file and appeal and the doctor wrote a letter advising why the "loud breathing" they said was a preexisting symptom, in fact had no set link to the diagnosis. 
This appeal was filed February 12th of 2018 and we were advised it would be within 30 days. Well at day 33 I had heard nothing and sent them an email and 3 days later, get an email that they need the original vet records (which they should have absolutely already had). So I get them sent over and email them to make sure they got them. 1 week later still have not heard anything so we call them and they advise they are still waiting on the records, so again we get them sent over. Another week of reviewing they finally close the claim again, zero payment.
Also within this entire claims process of waiting and going back and forth, they raised the monthly premium by almost double, so they were able to get even more money squeezed out of us, while they were going as slow as possible getting a resolution. 

I will accept the reasoning as to why the claim was denied, but the fact the entire process took almost 5 months, payments doubled, and they were never on the same page with each other I find very disappointing and will no longer be a policy holder.
title: Lack of communication and follow up.

text:
(posted on March 15th 2018)
I am a FIGO customer for nearly a year now. I'm transcribing below an e-mail/complaint I sent a week ago to their customer support, to which they didn't bother replying yet. I'll let you make your own judgement.

'I submitted claim # (XXX) under policy # (XXX) on January 27th 2018 for veterinary cost incurred on January 25th 2018.

My claim was closed today (March 8th 2018) and was denied in its full amount.

I understand that with any insurance policy there are exclusions. The reason for denying my claim was given as code 18: 'Denied due to specific exclusion in the policy terms and conditions'.

I wanted to investigate further what were the specific exclusions in my policy that resulted in the denial of this claim. I therefore chatted with FIGO customer support.

I was told that routine/preventive treatments are not covered, which I had read before in the FAQ section of FIGO's website. When I asked for documentation enumerating which treatments FIGO considers to be routine/preventive care, I learned, to my great surprise, that there was no such list.

This is deeply unsettling (...) FIGO cannot simply say that routine/preventive care is not covered without specifically describing which treatments are considered routine/preventive. FIGO customers or even prospective customers have the right to know this information. By not sharing this information, FIGO can ultimately deny any claim by stating it pertains to routine/preventive care. The customer has no appealing power because he/she does not know what routine/preventive care really means.

By omitting such apparently harmless information, FIGO is able to dictate the rules of any policy or claim as it wishes, leaving the customer completely powerless. This is a shameful strategy to extort premium payments from people without providing them with any transparency about the commercial agreement they sign off with FIGO.

I would like to stress that my complaint is not about my claim (...) but about the general conduct of FIGO, revealing bad faith towards its clients.'

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
(posted on April 6th 2018)
Updating my review above (posted on March 15th 2018), and not for good reasons...

Just a few hours after I posted the review above, FIGO finally got back to me, not just by e-mail but also by posting a reply to my original review as you can see here. It's sad to see that after a whole week of complete silence regarding my complaint, a simple, basic trick from my side (posting the same complaint on an online review website) triggered a response in just a few hours, even though the response didn't change anything at all. This shows total lack of respect for customers. FIGO is clearly more concerned about public image than with its customers.

Also, their response was: 'Per our policy, preventive care is deemed as any treatment, service or procedure, including but not limited to physical examinations, medications, surgeries, inoculations or laboratory procedures, for the purpose of prevention of illness or injury or for the promotion of general health, where there has been no illness or injury.' If you think about it, they're playing with semantics. When the policy says 'any treatment, service or procedure, including but not limited to...' the possibilities remain open to adding infinite new items to the list of treatments, services or procedures in question. That's what 'not limited to' means.

But the cherry on top of the cake was that just a couple of weeks after I got this unsatisfactory reply from FIGO, I was informed of my policy renewal premium: $757.20. It went from $348.45 in the first year to $757.20 for the second year! This is a 217% increase!!! I had seen reviews from other customers warning about their outrageous increases in premium, but this is absolutely unacceptable! What a rip off! Dropping out right now.
title: Absolute lack of coverage transparency

text:
I opened a claim on 12/12/17. Never got a call back until February 2018. However, I kept trying to contact them in-between those months. I was told to sit tight, which I did. However in Feb 2018 I got a callback from their claims department and was told that they are closing my claim due to lack of attention on my end. They kept claiming they sent me emails that the vet notes I sent were not actual vet notes or what they needed. I told them I did not receive those emails. They then insist I don't know how to use emails. I'm sorry, but that's not only rude but incorrect, I happen to make software for a living.
I called them back and asked if I can provide certain records, and was told by their CS department that "they don't know". This was about 24 hours before they suddenly closed my claim. 
The same day, I emailed them and I told them to give me back the remainder of my balance and just cancel my insurance. 6 days passed, no response. I then called them again, and they finally cancelled my policy. They wasted my $500 and several hours of talking to them. I patiently waited for their end to work for 2 months, but was punished instead.
Would you trust the wellness of your beloved pet to an insurance company that doesn't take you seriously enough to cancel your insurance policy, suddenly close your claims after two months of no response and lack of knowledge of their product?

==== RESPONDING TO FIGO ====

Thank you for responding to this review. I already cancelled my policies so having someone reach out is moot at this point. I am hoping my refund will not take long.

I appreciate your thorough response, you courteous presence online is what drew me to your service.

But for those who are shopping around, let me post the details of my claim.

9/12/17: Joined Figo. Paid $605.02 and $579.31 for my dogs.

12/12/2017 : Filed a claim of about $118 for one of my dogs.

12/15/2017 : Got an automated email about them transferring things in-house.

01/19/2018: Chatted with Figo. I initiated the contact since there was no feedback from them. Was told that claim will be finalized next week.

02/01/2018: Chatted with Figo.  I initiated the contact since there was no feedback from them. They said they're still waiting on medical records.

02/06/2018: Chatted with Figo.  I initiated the contact since there was no feedback from them. They said claim will be processed within two days.

02/07/2018: Got a call from Figo saying they are closing my claim if I can't provide certain medical records. They said they need the records within 48 hours otherwise they will close my claim. They had weeks to tell me this, but then surprise me with such short notice with what they need.

02/07/2018: Called Figo, asked what I can provide to help my claim, aside from submitting what I have via cloud. The customer service rep said that the claims department will call me back the before closing my claim, since I submitted documents via the pet cloud. The customer service rep was patronizing.

2/07/2018: Emailed to cancel my policy. The call earlier was very unsettling. For a mere $118 dollars I'm being given such extreme run-around.

02/13/2018: No response from Figo. Contacted them again. They finally cancel my policy and I was told I'll receive a refund of $290.57 and & $278.31.
title: Wasted 2 months and $500+

I thought they were great, but have only been covered one year, then BOOM, without warning, they INCREASED my rate by 77.4%!!!  Annual premium went from $630.32 to $1118.50!!!!  I called to ask if this was a mistake - i was told  it is due to age increase of pet and veterinary cost increases......my dog only aged from 1 to 2 years old (not like he turned geriatric at 2) and, i don't know about you, but I haven't been charged almost double this year than last year by my vet for wellness visits.....?  Could this be because the they applied my cat's surgery to my dogs plan and then upped the rate for their mis-assigned claim?? or is this case of "bait and switch"....give a good rate the first year then BOOM huge increases thereafter???  not a happy camper today seeing a 77.4% increase in my next year premium.

After "canned" response below - customer care did reach out -- and told me for a 50% increase in annual cost, i could have a policy that reimbursed 90% instead of 100% and for a 30% increase in annual premium  i could have a policy that reimburses 80% verses 100%. uh,  yeah... one year of good rates then raise the annual premium by almost double --or offer reduced coverage so you can keep payments lower...ugh!
title: WATCH OUT FOR HUGE INCREASES - 77.4% in one year!!!

text: I did considerable research with various pet insurance companies before signing up with Figo only about 3 weeks ago for my new Giant Schnauzer puppy, now 11 weeks old.   Figo's customer service representative, Jennifer, was so far above and beyond all others in her expert knowledge of both the policy options, coverage, and also of veterinary practices.....she was just very impressive.  I didn't feel like I was speaking to a phone operator who had been trained in a "sales pitch"....but rather someone who is truly expert in her field.  The Figo coverage options vs. premiums are better than all other companies I researched.  So I signed up with Figo after Jennifer spent considerable time on the phone answering my questions.  She is so impressive because she knows what she's talking about, doesn't sugar coat anything with a "smooth sales pitch", but just provides hard fact information in an exceptionally pleasant and accommodating manner.  But the true "meat of the matter" of an insurance company and chosen policy.....is their claims process and payment of claims.  Well, as luck would have it, (or lack thereof) with this new puppy......some Advil capsules spilled on the floor late in the evening on Labor Day weekend.......and although it was thought that all caps were properly picked up off the floor......a little while later, the puppy was found with an Advil in her mouth......and no telling if she had ingested more than what was found in her mouth or not.......seriously? At midnight on a Fri nite of a holiday weekend? ......off to the ER clinic we went.  There was a 5 day waiting period for accidents on the Figo policy.  Can't believe my good fortune, that this accident happened 7 days after signing up with Figo.  You can be sure that ER clinic visits on a holiday weekend and the additional testing needed were quite a significant expense.  Well.....Jennifer was every bit as pleasant, helpful, and expert in helping me with the claims process as she was at policy sign up time.  Today, a deposit was made to my account, reimbursing me what I was expecting according to my policy choices.  I am very pleased with my choice of Figo, and with all of the interactions I've had with them. Impressive customer service as applies to claims process and reimbursement. I'll be recommending Figo to all of my students and friends.  (I'm a dog trainer, and my students number in the hundreds annually).  BTW.....puppy has recovered fully, and is bouncing around happily.  What a relief to have had insurance that was in effect when facing the late nite ER visit fees.
title: EXCELLENT !!  HIGHLY RECOMMEND !!

text:
After 16 years of excellent health with our beloved cat she came down with an acute case of pancreatitis. As she was aging, and that incident cost us $6000 out of pocket, we decided to finally get insurance for her. We were concerned no provider would take us due to her age as several do not, but luckily Figo did. 

We were then extremely grateful when we got insurance as her health continued to decline over the next eight months, and we recently had to say goodbye to her. While Figo did not cover her existing pancreatitis, they covered everything else that happened the next 8 months. Which included chronic inflammatory bowel disease, an acute anxiety issue due to an alley cat, a urinary tract infection, a kidney tumor and finally our loss of her and the cremation process. 

We were reimbursed nearly all of the money of the claims we had submitted (minus a pancreatitis flare up), and only paid in a tiny fraction of that total dollar amount in monthly fees. I found the website and submission process to be easy once I figured out it would save time to always submit lab/exam notes with the invoice. The turn around time for claims processing and getting reimbursed was also surprisingly fast. 

On top of all of that they were incredibly empathetic, sympathetic and gracious with our loss. They made the emotionally painful process of closing the account nurturing and supportive. They even sent us a hand signed card several weeks later. 

Should we choose to get another furry friend in the future, we will start off with Figo from the beginning. I can't recommend them enough.
title: Easy to use, generous benefits and very supportive

title: Could not be happier !

text:
We got a new puppy and the vet recommended pet insurance. I was very skeptical and, after reading reviews of pet insurance companies, I didn't feel much better. I was about to give up when I found Figo. The website, sign up process, and pricing were straight forward and they promised to make pet insurance simple. I also liked that all of their documents and processes were online via the Pet Cloud and seemed easy to use. After reading some positive reviews, I went ahead and signed up (still somewhat skeptical).

Unfortunately, exactly one week and one day after we signed up for Figo, we got the "opportunity" to give it a test run when our puppy accidentally ingested a naproxen tablet. We took her to the vet expecting that they would induce vomiting and we would go home only to find out that the pill could be fatal. She was admitted to the hospital and spent three days and two nights in their care. Every day, when the hospital billing coordinator would call with the financial update, I crossed my fingers hoping that Figo would be as easy to work with as promised.

When the puppy was discharged, I logged into Figo's Pet Cloud and completed my claim in minutes (literally, it took less than 5 minutes). While waiting for a response, the nice people at Figo even sent my pup a get better soon card! A week after I submitted my claim, I got a response from Figo (accompanied by a call to ensure that I understood the details) and am thrilled to report that the vast majority of our bill was covered! There were no surprises as we knew our deductible and co-pay amount and, when I called to ask a question, I received a quick and helpful response. 

Based on our experience thus far, I highly recommend Figo Pet Insurance to anyone who wants some extra reassurance for their furry friends. We are even considering adding our older but healthy cat to the policy now that we know how quickly vet bills can pile up. Thanks Figo for turning me from a skeptic into a believer!
title: Fast, easy claims and excellent customer service!

text: Figo is super speedy with getting claims processed. Their customer service is amazing especially Lauren. She did a great job with answering any questions I had and making sure a check that was lost in the mail was expedited to me.

text: With two cats, and knowing the history of pet health care costs through long experience, pet insurance seemed like a no-brainer. After reviewing the available options, the logical solution was to choose Figo. Why? Figo offers the most affordable and accessible plans. When you do the math, it makes good financial sense. More significantly though, as anyone who has ever filed an insurance claim knows, the claims process is usually not the most pleasant experience between a consumer and the insurer. But I have found that Figo has turned that notion on its head. Claims are incredibly easy to file, amazingly quick turnaround time is also a big plus. What really clinched it for me was the customer service reps. They are not only friendly, courteous and super helpful, some of them know oodles about pet health, all of which makes every call a great experience. I cannot find any reason to go back to the old insurance model, especially when I can do everything from my iPhone. (Too bad for the cats, we can't conduct their vet visits from an iPhone.)

title: Excellent service and very user friendly

text: After getting a second (and eventually, a third) dog, I decided that pet insurance might be a good investment, as potential vet bills for 3 active dogs can add up quick. I did a lot of research and found Figo, and went with them because of all the benefits. Recently I had a few issues with my oldest dog, leading to a few visits to our vet, and eventually visit to an emergency vet for $2500. With all my claims, they were completed within a week, and the rep is always happy to answer my questions. My experience with customer service has been awesome too, and I've been recommending this company to everyone I know.
title: Best decision ever.

text: Great customer service and Pet Cloud is easy to use. I feel better knowing my Sunny is covered!
title: Figo Pet Insurance

text: This company was recommended by the veterinary hospital that attended to our dogs and I could not be happier with the coverage that is provided as well as the exceptional customer service we've experienced from the time we requested a quote to our first time submitting claims. Claims were approved within 2 weeks of submission and anything that was not covered was clearly identified (although 99% was covered for the surgery and treatment of our dog). Their website and app is very well-designed and easy to use. Definitely recommend!!
title: Excellent service and policy coverage

text: Customer service has been excellent.  It seems filing claims will be a snap.  I currently have another pet insurance for my two dogs, but they are raising the premiums extremely high.  FIGO's rates are competitive with great coverage.
title: Just signed up

text: The entire team at Figo has saved me over and over again. My friends speak of their disappointment and declined claims from Nationwide, Trupanion, and Healthy Paws, and I am so grateful to feel the exact opposite about Figo. I've never had a claim denied and I'm eternally grateful for not only their coverage, but their excellent staff who genuinely cares about my dog's health.  Simple "Get well soon" cards and occasional goodies like portable water/food bowls are cherries on top of a wonderful company. I would recommend them to anyone!
title: Best Pet Insurance with Real People Accessible to Help

text: I got insurance for my dog. I only pay about $30 a month and I have a $200 annual deductible and I get 100% reimbursement. My dog had an allergic reaction to something he ate and within 2 weeks, they had closed my case and were sending me my reimbursements. Very happy with this insurance company. They also were very helpful when my billing information changed and helped to make sure that I kept my pet insured. Without Figo, I would have been stuck with a $1000 vet bill
title: Great insurance company!

text: I reviewed every insurance company out there before choosing Figo, and  feel I have honestly made the best choice. Their  claim process has turned out to been as simple and transparent and they claimed it to be in their  literature. I, also, appreciate their website and having my pups records at my fingertips, but most importantly I feel confident that my dogs health needs will be covered in the future and this is well worth it.
title: Pet insurance that is easy, efficient and trustworthy

text:
Look around no further. This is simply the best and easiest insurance company to work with. In addition, they care about their fur babies and customers. They send a get well card immediately which is always welcoming, and whenever you need assistance  you call  and are speaking to the same person which gives you a sense of that small town feel where you don't have to deal with a random representative who doesn't know anything about you or the dog nor cares.

If only human health insurance were so simple! :-)
title: Simply the best

text: I thought having pet insurance was not needed when we first got our puppy, Charlie. but now I am glad we have it and I am so happy to have chosen Figo. Very easy to work with. I would recommend this pet insurance to anyone with a pet.
title: Figo, great pet insurance company

text: I submitted a claim to be applied towards my deductible.  Imagine my surprise when my cat Itsy Bitsy got a get well card from Figo.  Today I got an email notifying me that my claim had been approved and would be applied towards her deductible.  Can't get better customer service than that.  Thanks, Figo.
title: First experience

text:
We have two dogs, both were rescued.  Sven is a Lab/mix (l yr 4 mo) and and Zazu is a pit bull (6 mo).  We started to shop around for pet insurance after we adopted Zazu in March.  I have heard nightmares about pet insurance and how it is a scam, but that did not stop me from doing my research.  At first I was a little hesitant with signing up on FIGO.  Everything I read about FIGO and what they cover sounded almost too good to be true for the price I was quoted at. 
 
     We decided to give it a go and even ended up doing the 6 month waiver on knee related injuries for Sven just because we were already at our vet for Zazu's first round of vaccinations.  I could not believe it, but Sven ended up tearing his ACL just this past week; about three months into our policy start date.  Since we had his knee's waived everything is covered!!  The visit was covered and the surgery is going to be covered to!  Also, the fact that FIGO's staff is so caring makes this entire process that much easier on us.  I filled a claim and three days later we were sent a get well soon card in the mail for Sven.  Every time I call FIGO, the first thing they ask is how Sven is doing.  The staff is amazing.

I have already referred my entire family and friends to FIGO.  Every pet owner we stop to talk to at the pet store I end up mentioning my experience with FIGO.  FIGO is the best and most caring pet insurance out there.
title: Best decision we've ever made for our two dogs!!

text: I love my Figo Pet Insurance. The customer service is amazing, their claim process is super easy and their online tools allow me to keep track of my dog's records. Highly recommend it!
title: Great insurance, the reps always make you feel as a valued customer!

text: Great rates with awesome options, also keeping in touch with their customers with a lot of tiny goodies over the corner.
title: Amazing options, service , application and rates!

text: Submitted a claim for my dog.  It was very easy and simple.  All online and required only the veterinarian's invoice.  The amount claimed was under my deductible, and I knew I would get no reimbursement, but the breakdown of deductible and copayment was as advertised and as expected.
title: Claim process as advertised

text:
This review regards signing up and speaking with Judy P. The sign up could not have been easier. I sent Muncie's health records instantly, paid for a year, added his picture and read the policy information from the cloud. I have already recommended this company to fellow dog owners (I literally signed up yesterday) because it was so easy and self explanatory and the price was fair for great insurance. I researched several pet insurance companies that "google" linked. Not nearly as good, even the ones with a bunch of reviews. 

Judy (phone customer service) was great, smart and to the point. She answered my questions regarding the tag I'll be receiving with Muncie's code number. This benefit is good because if Muncie runs away :( and someone finds him, they can use the code number and text me without giving private information...name, address and phone #. There are many benefits to using the cloud, storing all his information, reminders, folders where I can store any info about him. Plus, there are maps to dog parks in case we travel with him. It is easy to file a claim (hope never) but if I have to the process is so easy. I will get the word out in my community as I am connected to a "neighborhood" website that shares everything.
title: We are new to FIGO

text: Figo has provided excellent service with an easy to submit claims process, timely communication, and quick reimbursement.  All representatives that I've communicated with by e-mail and by telephone have been professional, courteous, and seem to genuinely care about the health of our dog.  And they've even sent her get well cards!  I realize it's part of their routine process, but that attention to detail with a human touch is much appreciated.
title: Excellent customer service

text: I have had nothing but a good experience so far! I do a lot of research when it comes to making decisions and I'm so happy that I chose Figo. Their customer service has been amazing! They even sent my dog a get well card when we found out she was sick and eventually had cancer. Their pet cloud is very easy to use and I love how everything is just right there when you need it and it's so easy to submit a claim! If you are looking for a good insurance, choose figo!
title: Love Figo!

text: The customer service at Figo is top notch!  They go above and beyond to provide an exceptional customer experience for both the pet parent and the pet.  Using the pet cloud is a breeze and submitting a claim is so simple and user friendly.  To top things off, they even send get well cards to your pet and follow up with an email and phone call.  I'd recommend to Figo to anyone!
title: Excellent Customer Care

text: Surprised by all the 5-Star reviews.  After hearing rave reviews of FIGO, I purchased a policy for a puppy we rescued and was informed waiting periods would be waved for enrolling via their partnership with the shelter we adopted from.  Sadly, they did not honor their commitment to waive any of the waiting periods.  Would not recommend FIGO to anyone.

text: I'd never purchased a pet insurance policy before, but after my dog had knee surgery I realized the importance of coverage. I've recommended FIGO to numerous friends and relatives.  I love that they send my pet a get well card after she's seen the vet too.  What a special touch :-)
title: five star pet insurance

text: Lauren is such a great costumer service representative for Figo and makes me feel so much better about my pups care. She is always available, and though it's her job, she's always so cheerful and helpful! We had an issue with our claim and she sorted it out promptly. Thanks Figo!
title: Above and beyond!

text:
Lauren Karl is a wonderful employee, very informative & helped me understand the process of a new pet owner & my responsibilities of maintaining their health.  

She helped me navigate the app, showed me where I can look for pending claims to be accepted & how to reach out for any additional assistance. 

I am 100% satisfied with my choice in pet insurance.  Thanks again!
title: Great customer service!

text:
We lost a pet to cancer and when the time came to get another dog we decided to investigate pet insurance. I read hundreds of reviews and read the policies word for word. FIGO offered the best coverage out there, at any price. I also love their text customer service because I can't always call in when I'm at work. 

I signed my 1 year old and then 3 mo old English Bulldogs up with FIGO. Two weeks ago my now 5mo, Otis started throwing up after visiting dog daycare. Then he got a fever--long story short he had aspirated some vomit and contracted pneumonia on Easter Sunday! He ended up going to the emergency vet and then needing to have an IV and around the clock care for an additional 24 hours. His total care was about $2,000! We chose to have a $200 deductible and 10% co-pay. I was really nervous after I submitted our bills because I had remembered all of those awful reviews (of other pet insurance companies). My concern was for nothing because FIGO is awesome. They sent Otis a get well card and about 8 days after I had uploaded the bills to my pet cloud (no claim forms or anything), Lauren called me personally to tell me everything was processed. One less thing to worry about. :)
title: FIGO is the real deal

text: The customer service at Figo Pet Insurance is excellent and claims are very easy to file, as opposed to a previous insurance for a different pet.  The customer service people respond quickly and are very thorough in explaining benefits and claims procedures.
title: Terrific Service

text: My claim was submitted, a day or so later, I received an email saying my claim was being processed and then 2 days later, I received another email stating the claim was taken care of! And THEN I received a get well card in the mail to check on my pup! Very Classy! So refreshing from previous pet insurance companies! Even better then human health insurance companies lol! Thanks Figo! Really took the worry out of a very upsetting and stressful situation!

text: The customer service has been great - and they make it super easy to manage your policy online or by mobile, and many ways to contact them and get a quick response that doesn't include stopping what you are doing to sit on hold!

title: Thoughtful personal service and great coverage

text: I've never had pet insurance before, but adopted a 1 1/2 year old cat.  Since his prior life experience was not well known, I wanted to be prepared. text: I have two dogs. I was using Embrace but switched to Figo. They have been very responsive when asking questions. My only issues are have been that I had to ask specifically what would be an exclusion when purchasing the insurance. They did not come out up front like Embrace. It also takes some time for a claim to be processed. However, I do like that you can submit your own claims online. Lastly, I wish they offered wellness.
title: Great Insurance

text:
I switched pet insurance companies to Figo a few months ago. Figo representatives have called me to make sure that everything was satisfactory. That was nice.

Shortly after I switched to Figo, my Golden Retriever needed unexpected surgery. I thought for sure I was going to have a problem as I only had this coverage for a very short time. (I had been with my former insurer for 7 years). There was no problem at all and I was promptly reimbursed per my coverage. Thank you!
title: Figo review

text: I have had a wonderful experience with FIGO thus far. My dog was sick and needed blood work, X-rays, follow up visits, medication, etc.  once the deductible was met, they paid almost everything.  It took a couple of weeks to get my reimbursement but I thought it was fairly timely.  The only reason I gave 4 stars was because of this and because I have really only had one experience with them at this point.  I would definitely recommend FIGO.  This insurance saved me a lot of out of pocket expense with just one illness.  We never found out what was wrong, but it waded up quickly and was a very high vet bill!
title: Great Experience and would definitely recommend FIGO!

text: We were given pet insurance as a benefit at work. At first I was a little skeptical about it because working in the Veterinary field you find out real quick who's good and who's not. Once I got everyone uploaded into their own profiles shortly after a representative called and e-mailed me just to check in and see if I needed anything. She even made it personal and commented on how cute my cat was, which really goes to show you she researched my account before contacting me. Figo has more than proved themselves. Thankfully I have only had to submit one claim and they were very fast and explained everything. They even sent Brie a get will card which was personally addressed to her and hand written. That speaks volumes about how much they care. When you call their office you get someone right away and it's not outsourced which makes a huge difference. I am very please so far with everyone I have felt with.
title: Love them!

text:
We bought FIGO pet insurance for both our cat and our dog in September 2015. So far, they have been terrific! First, I love the portal where we put all the claim submissions---it's quite easy! Second, I really appreciate that Lauren calls or emails me whenever our claim has been processed. Further, she has taken the time (on multiple occasions) to share her expert perspective as a vet tech---specifically about some issues relating to my furry beasts. In addition, Lauren was very helpful in digging through the existing vet records (prior to committing) to let me know what would be considered "12-month-pre-existing", versus what would not. 

While I do wish that FIGO would also cover special required food (ie perscription food and probiotics, for example), all in all, I think they are really great! I was quite nervous about getting pet insurance, and I'm appreciative that they have made the process painless. 

Thanks FIGO!

PS> I think it's adorable that they send little 'get well' cards in the mail :) That said, you might want to consider emailing cards instead, and then putting that postage towards a good cause (ie ASPCA)...just a thought. But I really do think it's super cute!
title: Top notch service!

text: Great plan (they cover what they say they will cover)...no haggling!

title: Figo Review

Sometimes the exam fee is the biggest expense of my visit, so knowing it's covered is a great comfort!

text:

title: Figo Pet Insurance and Karl Sagan RULES!

text: I signed up for pet insurance after discussing it with some friends that do cat rescue. they all recommended it, and I'm so glad I decided to do it. figo provided great rates and their customer service is fantastic, any correspondence I've had with them has been friendly and helpful. one of my cats had to go in for a kitty cold, I submitted the claim that day and it was taken care of promptly. I'm very happy with my choice.
title: a must for pet owners

text:
Figo is great idea, however their employees are the worst I have ever come in contact with. During the difficult time after my dog was diagnosed with hemangiosarcoma I found myself having to call them to make sure claims were received with all needed documentation. The lack of empathy and down right rudeness from their employee ***** was appalling. When my dog died I emailed them because I was too upset to call them and I never heard back. Finally I called them and ***** answered and I let her know I had sent an email saying my dog had passed away. Her response was "I know, we got your email." That is literally all she said and then hung up. No empathy or I'm sorry or even thanks for letting us know we closed your policy. This agent ***** has repeatedly been unhelpful and useless when I have called in the past but I never complained as I assumed she may have been having a bad day. I didn't realize until this interaction that she actually just may be a horrible human. I have since had my family switch over to 24 Pet Watch Insurance. I would never recommend Figo to anyone as they are not animal lovers and do not care about owners. They made an extremely difficult time even worse with their lack of support and empathy. This is my experience and may not be the same for everyone as this is a personal review. However, I am heartbroken and saddened at the lack of care and support provided by this company. I hope they record their calls so they can review this and see how horrible their agent treats their Customers.

They also state that they process claims in a timely manner. I found this to not be true at all. I would call asking for updates months after I submitted  a claim only to be told they had a backlog and didn't have a time frame. However this was also by the same agent who would never even ask for my claim information or wait for me to give details to which claim I was referencing. It took months to get a claim paid out and they were rude the entire way through. 

I would also like to note that Figo is reporting my review because they want it taken down instead of addressing the issue at hand. I will not be silenced, shame on you Figo!
title: AVOID THIS COMPANY! If you love animals get your pet insurance elsewhere!

title: Excellent insurance, customer care is absolutely top notch, plans cover everything and they reimburse super quickly!!!!!

text: I was reluctant to get pet insurance because it is a fairly new thing that while growing up, most people didn't have. Now there are many options of highly rated pet insurance companies. I did my research and found Figo. The are based out of Chicago so it always feels good to support a local company. There offerings are very understandable and prices are competitive, if not better than other companies. My dog had an incident recently and Figo was extremely fast with reimbursement and communicated to me very well throughout the process (emails and calls). They even sent my little Ruby a get better soon card :). This company has no weaknesses. Here's my quick recap of Figo: Signing up is very easy, website/mobile app is wonderfully built and functions properly, customer service is on point, and their pricing is on par or better then the competition. I've already told my friends and family about Figo and I will be staying with them for the long haul.
title: Best Pet Insurance Hands down

text: The web site needs a thorough usability review.  In particular, some colors don't show up on all browsers -- specifically FIrefox and IE, which are widely used.  So, when trying to enter information or respond to required fields, they simply aren't visible to the customer.  Follow-up to questions is prompt but only after a frustrating experience.  Every web page should be tested on all major browsers to ensure that all fields are visible!  Don't let designers select colors that are problematic.
title: Usability issues but good service

title: Easy to see stuff

text: Great company! Their customer service is amazing and their Pet Cloud is super cool.  So happy I found them.
title: Awesome!

text: Figo has been nothing short of amazing in assisting with getting to know about and using pet insurance. One month after buying Figo my 4 month old kitten broke her leg. I was able to seamlessly submit my claims, receive assistance and ultimately my payout in a timely fashion. They even sent a get well card! I have a dedicated customer service rep which I have developed a relationship with. Overall it is a great value and user experience, both online and the phone. Yay Figo!
title: A complete service

text: Figo has been amazing and extremely accommodating for my family. They truly have my pet's health care at heart.
title: Wonderful Service!

text: Had to make one claim and it was seamless. I received the compensation very quickly. UX on website is great!
title: Seamless Claim

text: I was very confused shopping for pet insurance. I decided to go with Figo, even though they were a newer company on the market with not too many reviews, because their insurance looked pretty straight forward and simple. I also love their website, it is easy to use! I happened to have two incidences with my dog this year. He had to have surgery to have a lump removed and he was kicked by a horse and had to be observed and checked out for possible head injury. In both cases Figo was very fast to issue the refund stated in the policy and they care about your pet. They personally call you to see how your pet is doing and send the cutest get well card to your home. I am very impressed with Figo!
title: Great Pet Insurance

text: I did not have to use the insurance this year, but I lost one of my pets due to a pre-existing disease. I cancelled her insurance policy once I realized that I would not take advantage of the insurance. They readily responded to my request. After Coco passed I received a sympathy card signed by all the staff members, as well as a token gift that warmed my heart. Thank you Figo.
title: Compassion

text: i liked that when i called i got to talk to a real person right away- so far i havent had to use my insurance but rose looks great with her little figo tag!
